sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

sentences.english: I’m a slow typist.
sentences.chinese: 我打字很慢。

detailed_translations.english: a secretary whose main job is to  type  letters

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

sentences.english: The striped T-shirt became the comedian’s trademark.
sentences.chinese: 条纹T恤衫成了这位喜剧演员的标记。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商标， 牌号； 特征， 标记
detailed_translations.english: a special name, sign, or word that is marked on a product to show that it is made by a particular company, that cannot be used by any other company

name: memorial
trans: 记忆的； 纪念的； 追悼的
纪念物； 纪念碑； 纪念馆

sentences.english: A memorial service is being held for her at St. Paul's Church.
sentences.chinese: 一场为她举行的纪念仪式正在圣保罗教堂举行。

sentences.english: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

detailed_translations.english: done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died
something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

name: delivery
trans: 传递， 传送； 交付； 分娩

sentences.english: Most Indian restaurants offer free delivery.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印度餐馆提供免费外送服务。

sentences.english: You can expect delivery in a week to ten days.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在一周至十天内收到货物。

sentences.english: fresh milk deliveries
sentences.chinese: 新鲜牛奶递送

sentences.english: Mrs Howell had an easy delivery.
sentences.chinese: 豪厄尔太太的分娩很顺利。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing goods, letters etc to a particular person or place, or the things that are brought

name: pinch
trans: 撮， 微量；捏， 掐；紧缺， 短缺
捏， 掐， 拧， 挟

sentences.english: We have to stop her pinching her baby brother.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能让她再掐她小弟弟了。

sentences.english: He pinched her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了一下她的脸颊。

sentences.english: Put all the ingredients, including a pinch of salt, into a food processor.
sentences.chinese: 将所有的配料，连同一撮盐，放进食品加工机里。

detailed_translations.english: to press a part of someone’s skin very tightly between your finger and thumb, especially so that it hurts
A pinch of an ingredient such as salt is the amount of it that you can hold between your thumb and your first finger

sentences.english: a wine rack
sentences.chinese: 酒架

sentences.english: a magazine rack
sentences.chinese: 杂志架

sentences.english: His already infirm body was racked by high fever.
sentences.chinese: 他已经很孱弱的身体受到高烧的折磨。

detailed_translations.english: a frame or shelf that has bars or hooks on which you can put things

detailed_translations.chinese: 使痛苦， 折磨； 尽力使用
detailed_translations.english: If someone is racked by something such as illness or anxiety, it causes them great suffering or pain

sentences.english: an aural stimulus
sentences.chinese: 听觉刺激

detailed_translations.chinese: 听觉的；耳的；气味的；先兆的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the sense of hearing, or someone’s ability to understand sounds

name: conquer
trans: 征服， 战胜； 占领；克服， 破除

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: sculpture
trans: 雕刻， 雕塑 <；雕刻作品， 雕塑品

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

sentences.english: wax crayons
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance made of fat or oil and used to make candles, polish etc
to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

name: sensation
trans: 感觉， 知觉；激动； 轰动； 轰动一时的事情

sentences.english: One sign of a heart attack is a tingling sensation in the left arm.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

sentences.english: The sex scenes in the film caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片中的性爱镜头引起了轰动。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

sentences.english: He is old and unpopular. Furthermore, he has at best only two years of political life ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 他年纪已老，又不得人心，而且他最多也只有两年的政治生命了。

detailed_translations.english: in addition to what has already been said

sentences.english: The fight ended only with the timely arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏警察及时赶到，打斗总算停止。

detailed_translations.english: done or happening at exactly the right time

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: flame
trans: 火焰， 火苗；热情；光辉

sentences.english: Flames poured out of the windows of the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰从大楼窗口冒出来。

sentences.english: They rushed past us with buckets of water and tried to douse the flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们提着一桶桶水跑过我们身边去灭火。

sentences.english: They sat around the campfire, watching the flickering flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们围坐在篝火旁，看着跳动的火焰。

sentences.english: Flames quickly engulfed the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰很快吞噬了大楼。

sentences.english: a candle flame
sentences.chinese: 烛焰

detailed_translations.english: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire
to burn brightly

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

sentences.english: European farmers are planning a massive demonstration against farm subsidy cuts.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

detailed_translations.english: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

name: gage
trans: 标准尺寸， 规格； 量规， 量表

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准尺寸， 规格； 量规， 量表

name: modest
trans: 谦虚的， 谦让的； 适度的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: crush
trans: 压碎； 压坏；压服， 压垮

sentences.english: His leg was crushed in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 他的腿在事故中被压断。

sentences.english: Two people were crushed to death in the rush to escape.
sentences.chinese: 两个人在逃生过程中被踩死。

detailed_translations.english: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

name: hatred
trans: 憎恨， 憎恶， 怨恨

sentences.english: A look of pure hatred flashed across her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上闪过十足的仇恨表情。

sentences.english: the old hatreds and prejudices that simmered below the surface
sentences.chinese: 长久以来憋在心中的仇恨与偏见

detailed_translations.english: an angry feeling of extreme dislike for someone or something

sentences.english: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleus of an atom

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

name: promising
trans: 有希望的， 有前途的

sentences.english: a promising career in law
sentences.chinese: 很有前途的法律职业

sentences.english: a promising young actor
sentences.chinese: 大有前途的年轻演员

sentences.english: a promising start
sentences.chinese: 良好的开端

detailed_translations.chinese: 有希望的， 有前途的
detailed_translations.english: showing signs of being successful or good in the future

name: treason
trans: 谋反， 通敌， 叛国

sentences.english: The defendant was convicted of high treason (= treason of the worst kind ) and sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 被告被判犯有严重叛国罪，并处以死刑。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of being disloyal to your country or its government, especially by helping its enemies or trying to remove the government using violence

name: counsel
trans: 劝告， 忠告；法律顾问； 辩护人

sentences.english: He assisted me with good counsel and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 他以良好的忠告和鼓励帮助我。

sentences.english: Those who counsel US privately, point out that we are wrong, are true friends.
sentences.chinese: 那些私下忠告我们，指出我们错误的人，才是真正的朋友。

sentences.english: Their free guidance and counsel will be the most priceless gift you can receive.
sentences.chinese: 他们的免费指导和忠告，将是你能够收到的最无价的礼物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劝告， 忠告；法律顾问； 辩护人
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer who represents you in court

sentences.english: Three weeks ago, it was discovered the cancer had spread to his liver.
sentences.chinese: 三周前，发现癌已扩散到了他的肝脏。

detailed_translations.english: a large organ in your body that produces bile and cleans your blood

sentences.english: You must decide whether, on the balance of probabilities , he committed the crime.
sentences.chinese: 你们一定要权衡正反两方面的可能性，然后再裁定他是否犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

sentences.english: More people commit suicide at Christmas than at any other time.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节期间自杀的人比其他任何时候都多。

sentences.english: My mother attempted suicide on many occasions.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲多次试图自杀。

sentences.english: He apparently left a suicide note (= letter explaining his reasons for killing himself ) on his desk.
sentences.chinese: 他显然在桌上留了封绝笔信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of killing yourself

sentences.english: a book on biochemistry and physiology
sentences.chinese: 一本关于生物化学和生理学的书

detailed_translations.english: the science that studies the way in which the bodies of living things work

name: lofty
trans: 高耸的；崇高的 A；高傲的

sentences.english: He stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel, from whose lofty heights he could see across New York.
sentences.chinese: 他住在四季酒店，从酒店高处可以看到纽约的全景。

sentences.english: lofty ideals of equality and social justice
sentences.chinese: 平等和社会正义的崇高理想

detailed_translations.english: (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive

name: explicit
trans: 详述的， 明确的；坦率的

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

sentences.english: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose

name: prevail
trans: 取胜， 占优势；流行， 盛行

sentences.english: 英文编辑：the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

sentences.english: Justice will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 正义终将获胜。

detailed_translations.english: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

name: browse
trans: 嫩叶， 嫩芽；吃草， 放牧；浏览 A

sentences.english: a feature that allows you to browse your hard drive and choose the graphic you want to display
sentences.chinese: 让你可以浏览硬盘驱动器选择自己想要显示的图像的一个功能

sentences.english: ...a browse around the shops.
sentences.chinese: …在商店的一番闲逛。

detailed_translations.english: to look through the pages of a book, magazine etc without a particular purpose, just looking at the most interesting parts
Browse is also a noun

name: denial
trans: 否认；拒绝； 拒绝给予

sentences.english: The government issued an official denial of the rumour.
sentences.chinese: 政府发表了正式声明，否认谣言。

sentences.english: His girlfriend is in denial, and refuses to admit that he will soon die.
sentences.chinese: 他的女友不肯接受事实，拒不相信他很快就要死了。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that something is not true

name: implicit
trans: 不言明的， 含蓄的；固有的；无疑问的； 无保留的

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: futile
trans: 无效的， 无用的， 无意义的；没出息的；琐碎的

sentences.english: My efforts to go back to sleep proved futile.
sentences.chinese: 我努力想再次入睡，但怎么也睡不着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
detailed_translations.english: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

sentences.english: The connexion is not a simple derivation.
sentences.chinese: 这种连接并不只是衍生性的。

sentences.english: Syntactics is a subject to study abstract formal connexion among the signs.
sentences.chinese: 符号学是研究符号之间的抽象形式联系的学科。

sentences.english: Frequently consider the connexion of all things in the universe and their relation to one another.
sentences.chinese: 经常考虑宇宙中所有事物的联系和它们的相互关系。

sentences.english: His eyes roved round the supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼睛环视了一下超级市场。

sentences.english: The whole supermarket was ruined in a great fire.
sentences.chinese: 整个超级市场被一场大火烧掉。

sentences.english: The supermarket near our school will be reopened soon.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校附近的那个超级市场不久将重新开业。

detailed_translations.english: a very large shop that sells food, drinks, and things that people need regularly in their homes

sentences.english: an economic policy that caused great hardship for many people
sentences.chinese: 造成许多人贫困的经济政策

sentences.english: Many students are suffering severe financial hardship.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生经济非常困难。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes your life difficult or unpleasant, especially a lack of money, or the condition of having a difficult life

name: confuse
trans: 使混乱， 混淆；使迷惑， 使糊涂

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

sentences.english: The parents were not to blame for the tragic death of their son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子的惨死不是他父母的错。

sentences.english: a great tragic actor
sentences.chinese: 一名伟大的悲剧演员

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

name: dial
trans: 钟面， 刻度盘， 拨号盘

sentences.english: The lighted dial of her watch said 1.20.
sentences.chinese: 她手表上的夜光表面显示时间为1点20分。

sentences.english: I think I dialed the wrong number.
sentences.chinese: 我想我拨错号码了。

detailed_translations.english: the round part of a clock, watch, machine etc that has numbers that show you the time or a measurement
to press the buttons or turn the dial on a telephone in order to make a telephone call

sentences.english: He grins, delighted at the memory.
sentences.chinese: 想起往事，他咧嘴笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to smile widely
a wide smile

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

name: explore
trans: 勘探， 探究， 探索 A

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

sentences.english: Do you have strawberry?
sentences.chinese: 你们有卖草莓吗?

sentences.english: Then he drank strawberry juice through a straw.
sentences.chinese: 然后他用吸管喝了一些草莓果汁。

sentences.english: We have three flavors of ice-cream,vanilla chocolate and strawberry.
sentences.chinese: 我们有三种口味的冰欺凌，香草，巧克力和草莓。

detailed_translations.english: a soft red juicy fruit with small seeds on its surface, or the plant that grows this fruit

name: climate
trans: 气候；风气， 社会思潮

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ warm dry climate
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶温暖干燥的气候

detailed_translations.chinese: 气候； 风土， 地带； 风气， 气氛
detailed_translations.english: the typical weather conditions in a particular area

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

sentences.english: sandwiches with the crusts cut off
sentences.chinese: 切去边皮的三明治

detailed_translations.chinese: 地壳；外壳；面包皮；坚硬外皮
detailed_translations.english: the hard brown outer surface of bread

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

name: organization
trans: 组织， 机构； 体制， 结构

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: a covered terrace extending the full width of the house
sentences.chinese: 和房子同宽的有顶露台

detailed_translations.english: the distance from one side of something to the other

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger
to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

sentences.english: I shall be pleased to preside at your meetings.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴主持你们的会议。

sentences.english: Mr Justice Waller, presiding judge for the northeast
sentences.chinese: 沃勒法官，东北地区的首席法官

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a formal event, organization, ceremony etc

sentences.english: Economic growth is slow.
sentences.chinese: 经济增长缓慢。

sentences.english: the government’s economic policy
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策

sentences.english: Economic reform is needed.
sentences.chinese: 经济改革势在必行。

sentences.english: In the current economic climate (= conditions ), we must keep costs down.
sentences.chinese: 在当前的经济形势下，我们一定要控制好成本。

detailed_translations.english: relating to trade, in-dustry, and the management of money

sentences.english: crime/unemployment, etc. statistics
sentences.chinese: 犯罪、失业等统计资料

sentences.english: According to official statistics the disease killed over 500 people.
sentences.chinese: 根据官方的统计数字，500多人死于这种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of information shown in numbers

name: grim
trans: 讨厌的， 糟糕的；严厉的， 冷酷的

sentences.english: ‘I’ll survive,’ he said with a grim smile.
sentences.chinese: “我死不了。”他阴笑着说。

sentences.english: The police officers were silent and grim-faced.
sentences.chinese: 警察默不作声，神情严肃。

detailed_translations.english: looking or sounding very serious

name: stuff
trans: 原料， 材料； 东西

sentences.english: I’ve got some sticky stuff on my shoe.
sentences.chinese: 我鞋子上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: How do you think you’re going to fit all that stuff into the car?
sentences.chinese: 你说这么多东西你怎么装进车里？

sentences.english: I felt sorry for the ones who had to eat the awful stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我很同情那些只能吃这种难吃东西的人。

sentences.english: Where’s all the camping stuff?
sentences.chinese: 野营用的东西都在哪儿？

detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are

name: offspring
trans: 子孙， 后代；结果， 产物

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: arrest
trans: 逮捕； 拘捕； 停止； 中止

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with murder.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控谋杀。

sentences.english: I got arrested for careless driving.
sentences.chinese: 我因鲁莽驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: drugs used to arrest the spread of the disease
sentences.chinese: 用于控制疾病蔓延的药物

detailed_translations.english: if the police arrest someone, the person is taken to a  police station  because the police think they have done something illegal

sentences.english: The sorrowful widow begged for mercy.
sentences.chinese: 伤心的寡妇乞怜。

sentences.english: Tony hobnobbed with an attractive widow when he lived in Metz.
sentences.chinese: 托尼在梅斯居住期间曾与一名漂亮的寡妇交往甚密。

sentences.english: "I tell you the truth," he said, "this poor widow has put in more than all the others.
sentences.chinese: “我实话告诉你”，耶稣说道，“这个贫穷的寡妇放入的比其他人的都多。

detailed_translations.english: a woman whose husband has died and who has not married again

sentences.english: You can use the gym and pool for a fee of £35 a month.
sentences.chinese: 月付35英镑，即可使用健身房和游泳池。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you pay to do something or that you pay to a professional person for their work

name: section
trans: 章节；部分；地区；部门， 科 A

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

name: malignant
trans: 恶毒的； 恶性的；致命的 A

sentences.english: She developed a malignant tumour in her breast.
sentences.chinese: 她的乳房长了个恶性肿瘤。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 恶性的；有害的；有恶意的
detailed_translations.english: a malignant disease is one such as  cancer  , which can develop in an uncontrolled way and is likely to cause someone’s death

name: whip
trans: 抽打， 鞭打；搅打， 打成泡沫

sentences.english: He whipped the horse into a canter.
sentences.chinese: 他抽了一下鞭子，马儿就小跑起来。

sentences.english: The coachman cracked his whip and the carriage lurched forward.
sentences.chinese: 马车夫甩了一记响鞭，马车猛然向前冲去。

detailed_translations.english: to hit someone or something with a whip
a long thin piece of rope or leather with a handle, that you hit animals with to make them move or that you hit someone with to punish them

sentences.english: The rumor rocked the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 谣言使整个城市惊慌不安。

sentences.english: In fact the rumor is without foundation.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这个谣传没有根据。

sentences.english: The drains flooded and water overflowed down the main street.
sentences.chinese: 下水道被淹，水溢到了大街上。

sentences.english: The river had overflowed its banks.
sentences.chinese: 河水漫堤了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 满得外溢，外流，泛滥；充满，洋溢
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 淹没， 从…中溢出， 多得无法容纳
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 容纳不下的物； 溢出， 满出； 溢流口， 溢流管
detailed_translations.english: the amount of something or the number of people that cannot be contained in a place because it is already full

sentences.english: The receding tide stranded the whale.
sentences.chinese: 退潮把鲸鱼搁浅在海滩上。

sentences.english: So whale come out fish, because they are fish obviously.
sentences.chinese: 所以鲸鱼就是鱼，因为他们显然是鱼。

sentences.english: This sense of revelation is in part due to our changing attitude towards the whale.
sentences.chinese: 与鲸鱼感到关联部分是由于和我们对鲸鱼态度发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: a very large animal that lives in the sea and looks like a fish, but is actually a mammal

name: provoke
trans: 挑衅， 激怒， 招惹

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

name: threaten
trans: 有…危险， 预示凶兆 A

sentences.english: Postal workers are threatening a strike if they don’t receive a pay increase.
sentences.chinese: 邮政工人威胁如果不加薪，他们就要罢工。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you will cause someone harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: enrich
trans: 使富足； 使肥沃 <；使充实、 丰富； 使更有意义 A

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: strain
trans: 尽力；用力推， 用力拉
过度的疲劳， 紧张；张力， 拉力
扭伤， 拉伤；拉紧， 扯紧 <

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

sentences.english: The dealers applied for an export licence.
sentences.chinese: 经销商申请了出口许可证。

sentences.english: He was arrested for driving without a license.
sentences.chinese: 他因无照驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: The Tennessee Valley Authority applied for a license to operate the facility.
sentences.chinese: 田纳西河谷管理局申请了这个场所的经营执照。

sentences.english: The owner of land could grant a licence to cut and remove timber.
sentences.chinese: 土地所有者可发执照授权砍伐和运走木材。

sentences.english: I forgot to renew my licence.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记去办理执照展期了。

sentences.english: Persistent offenders face losing their licence.
sentences.chinese: 多次违规者将会被没收执照。

detailed_translations.english: an official document giving you permission to own or do something for a period of time

name: hunt
trans: 打猎； 猎取；搜索； 寻找
打猎， 猎取；搜索； 寻找

sentences.english: lion/rhino/stag etc hunt
sentences.chinese: 猎狮/犀牛/雄鹿等

sentences.english: the hunt for the missing child
sentences.chinese: 搜寻失踪儿童

sentences.english: Wolves tend to hunt in packs (= hunt in groups ) .
sentences.chinese: 狼往往成群捕猎。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when people chase animals in order to kill or catch them
to chase animals and birds in order to kill or catch them

sentences.english: a coal cellar
sentences.chinese: 煤窖

detailed_translations.english: a room under a house or other building, often used for storing things

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: intrigue
trans: 引起极大兴趣， 激起…的好奇心 ， 迷住
阴谋， 诡计， 密谋

sentences.english: Other people’s houses always intrigued her.
sentences.chinese: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

detailed_translations.english: to make secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power
if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴谋， 诡计， 密谋
detailed_translations.english: the making of secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power, or a plan of this kind

name: tangle
trans: 乱糟糟的一堆；复杂的问题；困惑， 混乱

sentences.english: My hair tangles easily.
sentences.chinese: 我的头发很容易打结。

sentences.english: His parachute became tangled in the wheels of the plane.
sentences.chinese: 他的降落伞缠在了飞机的轮子上。

detailed_translations.english: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 乱糟糟的一堆， 混乱； 复杂的问题； 困惑
detailed_translations.english: a confused state or situation

sentences.english: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
sentences.chinese: 她看看街名，试图确定自己的方位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应；确定方向；使朝东
detailed_translations.english: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map
the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

name: handicap
trans: 缺陷， 残疾 A；障碍， 不利条件

sentences.english: Not speaking the language is a real handicap.
sentences.chinese: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes it difficult for someone to do what they want
to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do

name: survival
trans: 幸存， 生存；幸存者； 残存物

sentences.english: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.english: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

sentences.english: the American rail system
sentences.chinese: 美国铁路系统

sentences.english: a high-speed rail network
sentences.chinese: 一个高速铁路网络

sentences.english: Passengers want a better rail service .
sentences.chinese: 乘客希望有更好的铁路服务。

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel and its rail links with London
sentences.chinese: 英吉利海峡隧道及其与伦敦之间的铁路连接

sentences.english: I need to buy a rail ticket .
sentences.chinese: 我要买一张火车票。

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票价

detailed_translations.english: to complain angrily about something, especially something that you think is very unfair

detailed_translations.chinese: 栏杆，横杆；铁轨，轨道；铁路
detailed_translations.english: the railway system

name: plea
trans: 恳求， 请求；抗辩， 答辩， 辩护；借口， 托辞

sentences.english: Caldwell made a plea for donations.
sentences.chinese: 考德威尔恳求捐款。

detailed_translations.english: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

name: inner
trans: 内部的， 里面的；内心的

sentences.english: an inner room
sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: inner London
sentences.chinese: 伦敦中心区

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。

detailed_translations.english: on the inside or close to the centre of something

name: keen
trans: 热心的， 渴望的；敏锐的； 头脑敏捷的；锋利的

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

sentences.english: a bowl of breakfast cereal
sentences.chinese: 一碗早餐麦片

detailed_translations.chinese: 谷类，谷物；谷类食品；谷类植物
detailed_translations.english: a breakfast food made from grain and usually eaten with milk

name: indifferent
trans: 冷漠的， 不关心的； 不积极的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: overhaul
trans: 彻底检修；赶上， 超过

sentences.english: The car needs a complete overhaul.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车需要大修。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
detailed_translations.english: necessary changes or repairs made to a machine or system

detailed_translations.chinese: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
detailed_translations.english: to repair or change the necessary parts in a machine, system etc that is not working correctly

name: cruise
trans: 航游， 巡航；缓慢巡行

sentences.english: We were cruising along at 50 miles per hour.
sentences.chinese: 我们以每小时50英里的速度平稳行驶。

sentences.english: We fly at a cruising speed of 500 mph.
sentences.chinese: 我们以每小时500英里的巡航速度平稳飞行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巡航；以节省燃料的速度前进
detailed_translations.english: to move at a steady speed in a car, aircraft etc
a holiday on a large ship

sentences.english: The eagle drooped its wings.
sentences.chinese: 那只鹰收拢双翅做俯冲。

sentences.english: Maybe they could not hold on to the arrival of the spring, but the female eagle thought what if their father could bring back the food?
sentences.chinese: 它们或许已经挨不到春天的到来了。 雌鹰这样想，但如果它们的爸爸会把食物带来呢？

sentences.english: She lacks the skill to accomplish this, but recognizes that an eagle can help her.
sentences.chinese: 她缺乏完成这项任务的能力，不过她认识到老鹰可以帮助她。

detailed_translations.english: a very large strong bird with a beak like a hook that eats small animals, birds etc

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

name: topic
trans: 话题， 主题， 题目

sentences.english: The environment is a popular topic these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今环境是一个热门话题。

sentences.english: The main topic for discussion will be the proposed new supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 讨论的主要议题是拟建中的超级市场。

sentences.english: a wide range of topics
sentences.chinese: 广泛的话题

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目， 论题， 话题
detailed_translations.english: a subject that people talk or write about

name: solemn
trans: 庄严的， 隆重的；严肃的

sentences.english: a solemn expression
sentences.chinese: 严肃的表情

sentences.english: Their faces suddenly grew solemn.
sentences.chinese: 他们的脸突然变得严肃起来。

sentences.english: a solemn procession of mourners
sentences.chinese: 庄重的送葬队伍

sentences.english: solemn ritual/ceremony
sentences.chinese: 隆重的仪式/典礼

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，庄重的；庄严的,隆重的
detailed_translations.english: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

sentences.english: It is dangerous to inhale ammonia fumes.
sentences.chinese: 吸入氨气是很危险的。

sentences.english: Myra lit another cigarette and inhaled deeply  (= breathed in a lot of smoke ).
sentences.chinese: 迈拉又点上一支烟，深深地吸了一口。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in air, smoke, or gas

name: perceive
trans: 察觉， 感知；理解， 领悟

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

name: option
trans: 选择， 选择权；选择的事物；选课

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

sentences.english: a bombing raid
sentences.chinese: 轰炸

sentences.english: an air raid warning siren
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报

detailed_translations.chinese: 袭击； 突入查抄， 突入搜捕； 劫掠
detailed_translations.english: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control

name: politics
trans: 政治， 政治学；政纲； 政见

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

name: acute
trans: 敏锐的， 尖锐的；急性的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

sentences.english: I to the kindergarten at the age of three.
sentences.chinese: 在我记忆中，我三岁就被送去幼儿园了。

sentences.english: She took me to the kindergarten and home every day, in spite of rain and wind.
sentences.chinese: 无论是下雨还是刮风，她每天带我在幼儿园和家之间穿梭。

detailed_translations.english: a school for children aged two to five

sentences.english: the Fiction Writer’s Handbook
sentences.chinese: 《小说写作手册》

detailed_translations.english: a short book that gives information or instructions about something

sentences.english: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
sentences.chinese: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。

sentences.english: Her death was totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 她的死完全出人意料。

sentences.english: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it

name: crucial
trans: 至关重要的， 决定性的

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: contribute
trans: 贡献； 捐助， 捐献；投稿；有助于

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

sentences.english: an emergency generator
sentences.chinese: 应急发电机

sentences.english: The company has been a very good cash generator.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是台非常出色的赚钱机器。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that produces electricity

name: remark
trans: 评语， 议论， 意见

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: endurance
trans: 忍耐； 持久， 耐久

sentences.english: She was pushed beyond her powers of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 她被逼得忍无可忍。

sentences.english: The marathon is a test of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的考验。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

sentences.english: The slightest movement will defocus the microscope.
sentences.chinese: 最轻微的运动都会使显微镜散焦。

sentences.english: The microscope magnified the object two hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 这架显微镜把实物放大了200倍。

sentences.english: The microscope capacitates small objects to be observed.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜可以观察到微小的物体。

detailed_translations.english: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

name: candidate
trans: 候选人， 申请人；报考者

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

sentences.english: I was still striving to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在努力争取成功。

sentences.english: Life is cruel, she thought, with a sudden rush of anger.
sentences.chinese: 生活真残酷，她想，心头突然涌上一股怒气。

sentences.english: a sudden movement
sentences.chinese: 突然的一动

sentences.english: Her death was sudden.
sentences.chinese: 她的死很突然。

detailed_translations.english: happening, coming, or done quickly or when you do not expect it

sentences.english: Stephen earned himself the nickname Hawkeye.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬得了个“鹰眼”的绰号。

sentences.english: When he got older I nicknamed him Little Alf.
sentences.chinese: 他长大些后，我给他起了绰号“小阿尔夫”。

detailed_translations.english: a name given to someone, especially by their friends or family, that is not their real name and is often connected with what they look like or something they have done
If you nickname someone or something, you give them an informal name

sentences.english: a literary genre
sentences.chinese: 文学体裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 类型；种类；体裁；样式；流派；风俗画
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of art, writing, music etc, which has certain features that all examples of this type share

detailed_translations.chinese: 风俗画的；以日常情景为主题的

name: scarcely
trans: 几乎不， 简直没有；刚刚 <

sentences.english: The city had scarcely changed in 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市20年中几乎没有什么改变。

sentences.english: The country had scarcely any industry.
sentences.chinese: 该国几乎没有工业。

sentences.english: He scarcely ever left the region.
sentences.chinese: 他几乎没有离开过这个地区。

sentences.english: He had scarcely sat down when there was a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 他刚坐下就有人敲门。

detailed_translations.english: almost not or almost none at all

name: panel
trans: 面， 板 A <；控制板， 仪表盘；专门小组

sentences.english: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 一组专家审核了那项提议。

sentences.english: There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.
sentences.chinese: 专家小组中至少有三名资深医生。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people with skills or specialist knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject

name: humanity
trans: 人类； 人性， 人情；人文科学 A

sentences.english: We want a clean healthy environment for all humanity .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望全人类拥有一个干净健康的生存环境。

sentences.english: crimes against humanity
sentences.chinese: 反人类罪

sentences.english: We must never forget our common humanity.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远不要忘记共同的人性。

detailed_translations.english: people in general

name: innovation
trans: 创新， 革新， 改革 A

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

sentences.english: There are a few things you should check before pressing the shutter release.
sentences.chinese: 在按快门之前，有几件事情你应该检查。

detailed_translations.chinese: 快门；百叶窗；关闭物；遮板
detailed_translations.english: one of a pair of wooden or metal covers on the outside of a window that can be closed to keep light out or prevent thieves from coming in

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…装百叶窗；以百叶窗遮闭

sentences.english: The two patterns alternate over periods of two to seven years in the tropical Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.english: To make the tiger blink, you alternate the transparency between the two areas by locating both the areas and paths in the corresponding XML.
sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

sentences.english: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数审判中，12名陪审员和2名替补人员会被选出。

detailed_translations.english: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern
two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

sentences.english: Steven’s still in bed with flu .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂文患了流感，仍卧病在床。

sentences.english: She’s got the flu .
sentences.chinese: 她得了流感。

sentences.english: I couldn’t go because I had flu .
sentences.chinese: 我得了流感，去不了。

sentences.english: Doctors now fear a flu epidemic .
sentences.chinese: 医生现在担心会出现流感大爆发。

detailed_translations.english: a common illness that makes you feel very tired and weak, gives you a sore throat, and makes you cough and have to clear your nose a lot

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

name: plunge
trans: 投入； 插进； 陷入；猛冲

sentences.english: The government's political and economic reforms threaten to plunge the country into chaos.
sentences.chinese: 该政府的政治和经济改革有可能使这个国家陷入混乱之中。

sentences.english: Eddy found himself plunged into a world of brutal violence.
sentences.chinese: 埃迪发现自己突然陷入了一个残酷暴力的世界。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth experience sth unpleasant

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

name: interview
trans: 接见， 会见； 采访； 面试

sentences.english: a portfolio of work presented at interview
sentences.chinese: 在面试时呈递的工作成果样本

sentences.english: a police interview
sentences.chinese: 警方问讯

sentences.english: We’re interviewing six candidates for the job.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作我们要面试六名申请人。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out whether they are suitable for a job, course of study etc
to ask someone questions during an interview

sentences.english: a naive young girl
sentences.chinese: 天真的小女孩

sentences.english: Jim can be so naive sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆有时候非常幼稚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幼稚的； 天真的； 轻信的
detailed_translations.english: not having much experience of how complicated life is, so that you trust people too much and believe that good things will always happen

name: essential
trans: 必要的， 必不可少的；本质的， 基本的

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

sentences.english: huge cuts in public expenditure
sentences.chinese: 大幅度削减公共开支

sentences.english: government expenditure on education
sentences.chinese: 政府的教育开支

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["spending by a company on buildings, machinery, equipment etc"],"COLLOINEXA":["capital expenditure"]}
sentences.chinese: 〔公司的〕资本开支

detailed_translations.chinese: 经费， 支出额； 花费， 支出， 消耗
detailed_translations.english: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

sentences.english: The metal glowed in the furnace.
sentences.chinese: 金属在熔炉里发出灼热的光。

sentences.english: An adjustable plate, as in the flue of a furnace or stove, for controlling the draft.
sentences.chinese: 挡板，调节风门一种可调节的薄片，如在熔炉或火炉的通气管中的，用来控制气流。

sentences.english: The graceful preface was laced by a commonplace maid near the furnace in the palace without any trace of embrace.
sentences.chinese: 这份优雅的前言是由一个平凡的侍女在宫殿里的火炉边，不留住拥抱过的痕迹而系上带子的。

detailed_translations.english: a large container for a very hot fire, used to produce power, heat, or liquid metal

sentences.english: Hey, your scarf is slipping off.
sentences.chinese: 喂， 你的围巾快掉了。

sentences.english: The scarf flapped her face.
sentences.chinese: 围巾轻拂着她的脸。

sentences.english: She muffled her throat with a scarf.
sentences.chinese: 她用围巾围住脖子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth that you wear around your neck, head, or shoulders, especially to keep warm

sentences.english: The government has ditched plans to privatise the prison.
sentences.chinese: 政府放弃了监狱私有化的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上掘沟；把…开入沟里；丢弃
detailed_translations.english: to stop having something because you no longer want it
a long narrow hole dug at the side of a field, road etc to hold or remove unwanted water

sentences.english: ‘My leg!’ he gasped. ‘I think it’s broken!’
sentences.chinese: “我的腿！”他倒抽一口气喊道，“我觉得腿断了！”

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
when you take in a breath suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain

sentences.english: You really gave us a scare !
sentences.chinese: 你真的吓了我们一跳！

detailed_translations.english: a sudden feeling of fear

name: thunder
trans: 大声说， 吼叫， 喊出

sentences.english: We were woken in the night by thunder.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我们被雷声惊醒。

detailed_translations.english: the loud noise that you hear during a storm, usually after a flash of lightning
if it thunders, there is a loud noise in the sky, usually after a flash of lightning
to make a very loud deep noise

sentences.english: There had been no direct damage in the fore part of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 没有对船的前部造成直接损坏。

detailed_translations.english: the fore parts of a ship, plane, or animal are the parts at the front
the front part
at or towards a ship's bow

name: observe
trans: 遵守， 奉行；观察， 注意到， 看到

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: furnish
trans: 供应， 提供  <；装备， 布置

sentences.english: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

sentences.english: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
sentences.chinese: 买下房子后，他们没有钱买家具了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装备，布置 （房间、建筑物）；供应，提供
detailed_translations.english: to put furniture and other things into a house or room

sentences.english: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你或你的伴侣习惯性地批评对方，其实你们是在攻击对方的人格。

sentences.english: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.chinese: 我们对运转中的国家的批评越多，我们就能更少地谈到我们所在的迷失的小岛。

sentences.english: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.chinese: 这两份报纸发现，基于达令总督的不得人心，他们拥有一大优势：严词批评总督的法令，和《公报》的过分阿谀拍马对着干。

sentences.english: She pulled the garment on and zipped it up.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上衣服并拉好拉链。

sentences.english: She works in the garment district of Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 她在曼哈顿的服装加工区工作。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing

name: rare
trans: 稀有的， 难得的， 珍奇的；稀薄的， 稀疏的

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: exclude
trans: 拒绝， 把…排除在外， 排斥

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

name: enlighten
trans: 启发， 启蒙； 教导

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

name: utmost
trans: 最远的；极度的， 极端的
极限， 极度； 最大可能

sentences.english: It is a matter of the utmost urgency to find out what has happened to these people.
sentences.chinese: 当务之急是弄清楚这些人出了什么事。

sentences.english: Security matters are treated with the utmost seriousness.
sentences.chinese: 安全问题受到极为严肃的对待。

sentences.english: The medical staff did their utmost(= tried as hard as they could ) to save the patient’s life.
sentences.chinese: 医护人员竭尽全力挽救那位病人的生命。

detailed_translations.english: greatest; most extreme
the most that can be done

sentences.english: The company deducted this payment from his compensation.
sentences.chinese: 公司从他的补偿金中扣除了这笔款项。

detailed_translations.english: to take away an amount or part from a total

name: image
trans: 形象；肖像， 影像， 图像

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

sentences.english: Sara looked white and fatigued.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉看上去脸色苍白，精疲力竭。

detailed_translations.english: extremely tired

name: ribbon
trans: 缎带， 丝带； 带， 带状物

sentences.english: little girls with ribbons in their hair
sentences.chinese: 头发上系着丝带的小姑娘们

sentences.english: a bundle of letters tied with pale blue ribbon
sentences.chinese: 一捆用淡蓝色丝带扎好的信

sentences.english: The ribbon was cut and the new station was officially open.
sentences.chinese: 剪彩后，新车站正式开始运营。

detailed_translations.chinese: 带；缎带；（勋章等的）绶带；带状物；勋表
detailed_translations.english: a narrow piece of attractive cloth that you use, for example, to tie your hair or hold things together

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…撕成条带；用缎带装饰

name: portray
trans: 描写， 描绘；扮演， 饰演

sentences.english: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.english: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
sentences.chinese: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

detailed_translations.english: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

sentences.english: flights between a Greek island and the mainland
sentences.chinese: 希腊一海岛和本土之间的航班

detailed_translations.english: the main area of land that forms a country, as compared to islands near it that are also part of that country

name: profound
trans: 深的， 深刻的， 意义深远的；渊博的， 造诣深的

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

name: homogeneous
trans: 同种类的， 同性质的， 有相同特征的

sentences.english: a homogeneous society
sentences.chinese: 同种族人组成的社会

detailed_translations.english: consisting of people or things that are all of the same type

name: affirm
trans: 断言， 肯定；证实， 宣誓说实话

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

sentences.english: The columns were of white marble.
sentences.chinese: 柱子是白色的大理石。

sentences.english: a marble statue
sentences.chinese: 大理石雕像

detailed_translations.chinese: 大理石；大理石制品；弹珠
detailed_translations.english: a type of hard rock that becomes smooth when it is polished, and is used for making buildings,  statue s  etc

name: necessity
trans: 必需品；必要性， 需要

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

sentences.english: It will be a cold night, and there may be fog patches .
sentences.chinese: 今夜天气寒冷，部分地区可能有雾。

sentences.english: A blanket of fog covered the fields.
sentences.chinese: 大雾笼罩了田野。

sentences.english: The fog lifted (= disappeared ) in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午，雾散了。

detailed_translations.english: cloudy air near the ground which is difficult to see through

detailed_translations.chinese: 使模糊；使困惑；以雾笼罩
detailed_translations.english: if something made of glass fogs or becomes fogged, it becomes covered in small drops of water that make it difficult to see through

sentences.english: Newman played a central role in framing the new law.
sentences.chinese: 纽曼在拟定新法的过程中发挥了主要作用。

sentences.english: Energy consumption rises as countries industrialize.
sentences.chinese: 能源消耗随着各国工业化而增加。

detailed_translations.english: When a country industrializes or is industrialized, it develops a lot of industries

name: origin
trans: 起源， 由来；出身， 来历

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: vocal
trans: 嗓音的， 发声的；直言不讳的

sentences.english: vocal music
sentences.chinese: 声乐

sentences.english: Allison’s vocal style is influenced by country and blues music.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森的演唱风格受到乡村音乐和布鲁斯音乐的影响。

sentences.english: a female vocal group
sentences.chinese: 女子歌唱组合

detailed_translations.chinese: 喜欢畅所欲言的，直言不讳的；嗓音的，发声的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the voice or to singing
the part of a piece of music that is sung rather than played on an instrument

sentences.english: Troops clashed near the border.
sentences.chinese: 军队在边境附近发生了冲突。

sentences.english: It could have been an accident, but that was hardly likely (= not very likely ).
sentences.chinese: 这有可能是意外事故，但可能性不大。

sentences.english: I’d very likely have done the same thing in your situation.
sentences.chinese: 我要是处在你这种情况，也很有可能会那样做的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is likely will probably happen or is probably true
probably

name: issue
trans: 发行， 发表； 颁布 <
发行， 期号；问题； 争论点， 争端

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

name: literally
trans: 照字面意义； 逐字地；确实地， 真正地 A

sentences.english: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

detailed_translations.english: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

name: lower
trans: 较低的， 下级的； 下游的

sentences.english: Temperatures will be lower over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 周末气温会下降。

sentences.english: She lowered her newspaper and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她放低报纸往四下看了看。

detailed_translations.english: smaller in number or amount
to let or make sth/sb go down

name: index
trans: 附以索引， 编入索引

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

sentences.english: Hannah looked up to see David and another man standing in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 汉纳抬起头，看到戴维和另一个男人站在门口。

detailed_translations.english: the space where a door opens into a room or building

sentences.english: So when you fry, bake, grill, or roast potatoes you could be generating potentially harmful carcinogens.
sentences.chinese: 因此当你油炸、烘烤、烧烤或者炒土豆时，有可能会产生有害的致癌物。

detailed_translations.english: the young of various species of fish
to cook something in hot fat or oil, or to be cooked in hot fat or oil

name: odd
trans: 奇数的； 单的；奇怪的， 古怪的；临时的； 不固定的；带零头的， 余的

sentences.chinese: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.english: an odd way to behave
sentences.chinese: 古怪的行为

sentences.english: They’re an odd couple.
sentences.chinese: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.english: There was something odd about him.
sentences.chinese: 他这人有些奇怪。

sentences.english: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

sentences.english: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

detailed_translations.english: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand

name: conservation
trans: 保存； 保护； 保守 <；守恒， 不灭

sentences.english: wildlife conservation
sentences.chinese: 野生生物保护

sentences.english: a local conservation group
sentences.chinese: 当地的一个环境保护团体

detailed_translations.english: the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, forests etc, to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed

sentences.english: vitamins and other dietary supplements
sentences.chinese: 各种维生素和其他膳食补充剂

detailed_translations.chinese: 增补， 补充； 增刊， 副刊
detailed_translations.english: something that you add to something else to improve it or make it complete
to add something, especially to what you earn or eat, in order to increase it to an acceptable level

name: contrast
trans: 使与…对比， 使与…对照 <
对照， 对比， 差异

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

sentences.english: In systems such as this we also often find that there are either no tests around this configuration code, or the tests that do exist are brittle and/or not realistic.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的系统中，我们经常会发现对于这些配置代码没有进行测试，或者尽管存在测试，但它很脆弱且/或不切实际。

sentences.english: But while our screens are brittle, theirs is flexible––at what they say is one tenth the price.
sentences.chinese: 但我们的屏幕都很脆弱，他们的却很柔软，而且价钱是我们的十分之一。

name: occurrence
trans: 发生， 出现；事件， 事故， 发生的事情

sentences.english: The greatest occurrence of coronary heart disease is in those over 65.
sentences.chinese: 冠心病的最高发病率在65岁以上的人群中。

sentences.english: Complaints seemed to be an everyday occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 投诉似乎成了天天发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of something happening

sentences.english: an amplified guitar
sentences.chinese: 带有扩音设备的电吉他

detailed_translations.chinese: 放大， 增强； 扩大； 详述， 进一步阐述
detailed_translations.english: to make sound louder, especially musical sound

sentences.english: Inflation is now at over 16%.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

detailed_translations.english: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

name: disposal
trans: 处理， 处置；布置， 安排

sentences.english: bomb disposal experts
sentences.chinese: 拆弹专家

detailed_translations.english: when you get rid of something

sentences.english: the social whirl of New York publishing
sentences.chinese: 纽约出版界纷繁的社交活动

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转，回旋；昏乱；一连串的事；短暂的旅行
detailed_translations.english: a spinning movement or the shape of something that is spinning

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转，回旋；急走；头晕眼花
detailed_translations.english: to turn or spin around very quickly, or to make someone or something do this

name: settlement
trans: 解决； 决定； 调停；居留区， 住宅区 A

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: recede
trans: 退， 退去； 渐渐远去；向后倾斜， 缩 A

sentences.english: The flood waters finally began to recede in November.
sentences.chinese: 11 月，洪水终于开始退去。

detailed_translations.english: if water recedes, it moves back from an area that it was covering

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: literature
trans: 文学， 文学作品； 文献

sentences.english: He has read many of the major works of literature.
sentences.chinese: 他读过许多重要的文学作品。

sentences.english: Italian literature
sentences.chinese: 意大利文学

sentences.english: literature on the history of science
sentences.chinese: 科学史的文献资料

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学，文学作品；文献；文献
detailed_translations.english: books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good

name: sphere
trans: 球； 球体；范围； 领域

sentences.english: Because the earth spins, it is not a perfect sphere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

detailed_translations.english: a ball shape

detailed_translations.chinese: 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

sentences.english: a brain tumour
sentences.chinese: 脑瘤

detailed_translations.english: a mass of diseased cells in your body that have divided and increased too quickly

sentences.english: Most babies can digest a wide range of food easily.
sentences.chinese: 大多数婴儿能轻易地消化很多种食物。

sentences.english: I struggled to digest the news.
sentences.chinese: 我费力地琢磨着那条新闻。

sentences.english: a monthly news digest
sentences.chinese: 每月新闻摘要

detailed_translations.english: to change food that you have just eaten into substances that your body can use
a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc

name: dependence
trans: 依靠， 依赖； 信任

sentences.chinese: …这个城市对旅游业的传统依赖。

detailed_translations.english: when you depend on the help and support of someone or something else in order to exist or be successful

sentences.english: the ability to walk
sentences.chinese: 行走的能力

sentences.english: The test measures your mathematical ability.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试考查的是数学能力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being able to do something

name: belief
trans: 信仰， 信条 A；相信， 信念

sentences.english: a strong belief in God
sentences.chinese: 笃信上帝

sentences.english: When you get something wrong, it can shake your belief in yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么事情没做好，就会动摇你对自己的信心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

sentences.english: The Senate had a sufficient majority to override the presidential veto (= not accept his refusal ).
sentences.chinese: 参议院有足够的多数票可以推翻总统的否决。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed

name: vest
trans: 背心， 马甲； 汗衫， 内衣

sentences.english: a bulletproof vest
sentences.chinese: 防弹背心

detailed_translations.english: a piece of underwear without sleeves that you wear on the top half of your body

sentences.english: Colour the tiger lantern brown .
sentences.chinese: 把老虎灯笼涂成棕色。

sentences.english: Lantern owners write riddles on a piece of paper and post them on the lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 灯笼的所有者将谜语写在一张纸条上，然后将纸条展示在灯笼上。

sentences.english: To cheer themselves as well as they could, they made an artificial morning with the lantern, some bread and butter, and their own conversation, the real morning being far from come.
sentences.chinese: 为了尽量使自己高兴起来，他们就用提灯制造出人造的黎明，吃着黄油面包，谈天说地，其实真正的黎明还远没有到来。

trans: 处理；天性； 气质；排列， 部署

sentences.chinese: 这种骑乘不适合紧张型性格的人。

sentences.english: a map showing the disposition of American forces
sentences.chinese: 显示美军部署的地图

sentences.english: Neither side shows the slightest disposition to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 双方都没有表露出丝毫妥协的意思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 性格；排列,部署；倾向,意向

name: slender
trans: 修长的， 苗条的； 细长的；微小的； 微薄的

sentences.chinese: 她身材修长，穿着时髦。

sentences.english: The company only has a slender hope of survival.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司维持下去的希望很渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: thin in an attractive or graceful way

sentences.english: oral history
sentences.chinese: 口述的历史

sentences.english: an oral agreement
sentences.chinese: 口头协议

detailed_translations.english: spoken, not written
a spoken test, especially in a foreign language

name: compensate
trans: 补偿， 赔偿， 弥补

sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: transaction
trans: 办理， 处理；交易； 事务

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: conscious
trans: 意识到的， 自觉的； 有意识的

sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

sentences.english: a fur coat
sentences.chinese: 裘皮大衣

detailed_translations.english: the thick soft hair that covers the bodies of some animals, such as cats, dogs, and rabbits

detailed_translations.chinese: 用毛皮覆盖；使穿毛皮服装

sentences.english: She was wearing dark blue pants and a white sweater.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着深蓝色长裤和白色毛衣。

sentences.english: a pair of pants
sentences.chinese: 一件内裤

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that covers you from your waist to your feet and has a separate part for each leg

name: certify
trans: 证明； 保证；发证书给

sentences.english: The accounts were certified by an auditor.
sentences.chinese: 这些账目经审计员核实过。

sentences.english: Cars cause pollution, both smog and acid rain.
sentences.chinese: 汽车引起污染，既有烟雾又有酸雨。

detailed_translations.english: dirty air that looks like a mixture of smoke and  fog  , caused by smoke from cars and factories in cities

name: solitary
trans: 单独的， 独自的；单个的， 唯一的；孤独的， 隐居的

sentences.english: a long, solitary walk
sentences.chinese: 独自一人的长距离散步

detailed_translations.english: doing something without anyone else with you
someone who lives completely alone

name: locker
trans: 储物柜， 有锁的橱柜

sentences.english: a meat locker
sentences.chinese: 肉类冷藏间

detailed_translations.chinese: 柜，箱；上锁的人；有锁的橱柜；锁扣装置；有锁的存物柜
detailed_translations.english: a small cupboard with a lock in a school, sports building, office etc, where you can leave clothes or possessions while you do something

sentences.english: He directed an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥一个管弦乐队。

sentences.english: She conducted an orchestra of forty instruments.
sentences.chinese: 她在一个拥有40种乐器的管弦乐队里当指挥。

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose
