sentences.chinese: 炮声隆隆，鼓乐齐鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大炮；加农炮；榴弹炮；机关炮
detailed_translations.english: a large heavy powerful gun that was used in the past to fire heavy metal balls

sentences.english: Shortly afterward, police arrested four suspects.
sentences.chinese: 之后不久，警方逮捕了４名嫌疑犯。

detailed_translations.english: If you do something or if something happens afterward, you do it or it happens after a particular event or time that has already been mentioned

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

sentences.english: I just shrugged my shoulders and ignored him.
sentences.chinese: 我只是耸耸肩，没有理睬他。

sentences.english: ‘Suit yourself,’ he said with a shrug.
sentences.chinese: “随你的便。”他耸耸肩说道。

detailed_translations.english: to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something
a movement of your shoulders upwards and then downwards again that you make to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: awkward
trans: 笨拙的， 不灵活的；棘手的； 尴尬的；使用不便的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: ruin
trans: 毁灭， 毁坏； 破产； 堕落

sentences.english: an interesting old ruin
sentences.chinese: 一处有意思的古老废墟

sentences.english: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
sentences.chinese: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

sentences.english: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

sentences.english: This illness has ruined my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed
to make someone lose all their money

sentences.english: ...a leg of mutton.
sentences.chinese: …一条羊腿。

detailed_translations.english: the meat from a sheep

sentences.english: One thing I’ve noticed is that when people have to wait, they become impatient or uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到一件事，就是当人们在等待的时候，人们会变的没有耐心、焦躁不安。

sentences.english: Katie almost spilled her milk.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂差点把牛奶洒出来。

detailed_translations.english: if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container
if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container

sentences.english: She rocked the cradle to quieten the child.
sentences.chinese: 她摇动摇篮，让宝宝安静下来。

sentences.english: Athens is often regarded as the cradle of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 雅典常常被认为是民主的发源地。

detailed_translations.english: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

sentences.english: Surveys conducted in other countries reported similar findings.
sentences.chinese: 在其他国家进行的调查也报告说有类似的结果。

detailed_translations.english: the information that someone has discovered as a result of their study, work etc

sentences.english: a research laboratory
sentences.chinese: 研究实验室

sentences.english: tests on laboratory animals
sentences.chinese: 在实验室动物身上做的试验

detailed_translations.english: a special room or building in which a scientist does tests or prepares substances

sentences.english: He is well grounded in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 他拉丁语的功底很扎实。

sentences.english: I must brush up on my Latin.
sentences.chinese: 我必须把拉丁语重温一下。

sentences.english: This word comes from Latin.
sentences.chinese: 这个词源于拉丁语。

detailed_translations.english: the language used in ancient Rome

name: inspect
trans: 检查， 调查， 视察

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: campaign
trans: 战役；活动； 竞选运动

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: vital
trans: 生死攸关的， 重大的；生命的， 生机的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: conflict
trans: 战斗， 斗争；矛盾， 冲突

sentences.english: the threat of industrial conflict in the coalfields
sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

sentences.english: The files need updating.
sentences.chinese: 这些档案需要更新。

detailed_translations.english: to add the most recent information to something
the most recent news or information about something

name: detect
trans: 察觉， 发觉；侦察， 探测

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

sentences.english: a gifted amateur
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的业余爱好者

sentences.english: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
sentences.chinese: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

sentences.english: ...professional athletes and amateur runners.
sentences.chinese: …专业运动员和业余赛跑运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行
detailed_translations.english: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

name: condemn
trans: 谴责， 指责 A；判刑， 宣告有罪

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

sentences.english: We offer financial assistance to students.
sentences.chinese: 我们向学生提供经济援助。

sentences.english: Can I be of any assistance (=  can I help you  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 我能帮什么忙吗？

detailed_translations.english: help or support

sentences.english: the Gulf of Mexico
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥湾

detailed_translations.english: a large area of sea partly enclosed by land

sentences.english: a dictionary definition
sentences.chinese: 词典里的释义

detailed_translations.english: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means

name: sneeze
trans: 打喷嚏， 发出打喷嚏声

sentences.english: She started coughing and sneezing.
sentences.chinese: 她开始咳嗽、打喷嚏。

sentences.english: The dust was making him sneeze .
sentences.chinese: 灰尘使他打起了喷嚏。

detailed_translations.english: if you sneeze, air suddenly comes from your nose, making a noise, for example when you have a cold
the act or sound of sneezing

name: shave
trans: 剃， 刮， 刨， 削

sentences.english: He hadn’t shaved for days.
sentences.chinese: 他已经好几天没刮脸了。

sentences.english: Brian had cut himself shaving .
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩刮胡子时割破了脸。

detailed_translations.english: to cut off hair very close to the skin, especially from the face, using a  razor

sentences.english: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
sentences.chinese: 摘要另写一页。

sentences.english: It says torture and summary execution are common.
sentences.chinese: 据说酷刑和草草处决很常见。

detailed_translations.english: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations

sentences.english: a nickel alloy
sentences.chinese: 镍合金

sentences.english: ...a large glass jar filled with pennies, nickels, dimes, and quarters.
sentences.chinese: …一个装满1分、5分、10分和25分硬币的大玻璃罐。

detailed_translations.english: a hard silver-white metal that is often combined with other metals, for example to make steel. It is a chemical element: symbol Ni

sentences.english: She tried to accustom herself to the tight bandages.
sentences.chinese: 她尝试着使自己习惯那些紧绷的绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself or another person become used to a situation or place

name: entail
trans: 牵涉； 使成为必要；限定继承人

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

sentences.english: the spreading of political propaganda
sentences.chinese: 政治宣传的开展

sentences.english: the government propaganda machine
sentences.chinese: 政府的宣传机器

detailed_translations.english: information which is false or which emphasizes just one part of a situation, used by a government or political group to make people agree with them

name: inferior
trans: 下等的， 下级的； 差的， 次的  <

sentences.english: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.chinese: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: wine of inferior quality
sentences.chinese: 劣质葡萄酒

sentences.english: inferior goods
sentences.chinese: 质量低劣的商品

detailed_translations.english: not good, or not as good as someone or something else
someone who has a lower position or rank than you in an organization

sentences.english: Burning sulphur creates poisonous fumes.
sentences.chinese: 燃烧的硫磺会产生有毒烟雾。

detailed_translations.english: a common light yellow chemical substance that burns with a very strong unpleasant smell, and is used in drugs, explosives, and industry. It is a chemical element :symbol S

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: dramatic
trans: 戏剧的； 戏剧性的；巨大的； 突然的

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: certainty
trans: 必然， 肯定；必然的事

sentences.english: the certainty of being caught
sentences.chinese: 被抓的必然

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something is certain to happen

name: spine
trans: 脊骨， 脊柱， 脊椎；刺， 刺毛 A；书脊

sentences.english: cactus spines
sentences.chinese: 仙人掌的刺

detailed_translations.chinese: 脊柱， 脊椎； 刺， 刺毛； 书脊
detailed_translations.english: the row of bones down the centre of your back that supports your body and protects your  spinal cord

sentences.english: The paper was highly commended in the UK Press Awards.
sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。

sentences.english: Colleagues, I commend this report to you.
sentences.chinese: 各位同事，我向你们推荐这份报告。

detailed_translations.english: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

sentences.english: Acidic water will corrode the pipes.
sentences.chinese: 酸性水会腐蚀管子。

detailed_translations.english: if metal corrodes, or if something corrodes it, it is slowly destroyed by the effect of water, chemicals etc

sentences.english: Before singing, he noodled at his guitar.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌之前他先弹了几下吉他。

sentences.english: He strummed his guitar when he talked to me.
sentences.chinese: 他和我说话时把吉他拨弄响了。

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument usually with six strings that you play by pulling the strings with your fingers or with a  plectrum (= small piece of plastic, metal etc )

sentences.english: The male mosquito never stings.
sentences.chinese: 雄蚊不叮。

sentences.english: Are your mosquito bites still itching?
sentences.chinese: 你被蚊子咬的地方还痒吗?

sentences.english: The frog darted out its tongue to catch a mosquito.
sentences.chinese: 这只青蛙突然伸出舌头捕捉蚊子。

detailed_translations.english: a small flying insect that sucks the blood of people and animals, sometimes spreading the disease  malaria

name: artificial
trans: 人工的， 人造的；矫揉造作的

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

sentences.english: Kangaroos harbour a vast range of parasites.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠身上有各种各样的寄生虫。

detailed_translations.english: a plant or animal that lives on or in another plant or animal and gets food from it

name: deficiency
trans: 缺乏， 不足；缺陷， 缺点

sentences.english: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

sentences.english: There are deep deficiencies in this law.
sentences.chinese: 这条法律存在严重的缺陷。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of something that is necessary

sentences.english: As she listened, she played an imaginary piano on her knees.
sentences.chinese: 她边听边在膝盖上作弹钢琴状。

sentences.english: We must protect older people from harm, whether it is real or imaginary.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须保护老人免受伤害，无论这伤害是真实的还是假想的。

detailed_translations.english: not real, but produced from pictures or ideas in your mind

sentences.english: the removal of rubbish
sentences.chinese: 移除垃圾

sentences.english: stain removal
sentences.chinese: 去污

detailed_translations.english: when something is taken away from, out of, or off the place where it is

name: comment
trans: 注释； 评论； 意见

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

sentences.english: That chair doesn’t look very sturdy.
sentences.chinese: 那把椅子看上去不太结实。

sentences.english: They kept up a sturdy opposition to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直坚决反对那项计划。

detailed_translations.english: (of an object) strong and not easily damaged

sentences.english: the fable of the fox and the crow
sentences.chinese: 狐狸和乌鸦的寓言故事

detailed_translations.english: a traditional short story that teaches a moral lesson, especially a story about animals

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

sentences.english: Has your flat got a balcony?
sentences.chinese: 你的公寓有阳台吗？

detailed_translations.english: a structure that you can stand on, that is attached to the outside wall of a building, above ground level

name: consist
trans: 在于， 存在于；由…组成， 由…构成

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

name: preparation
trans: 准备， 预备；制剂， 制备品

sentences.english: This dish is good for dinner parties because much of the preparation can be done ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜适合宴会，因为很多准备工作可以事先做好。

sentences.english: Plans for the new school are now in preparation .
sentences.chinese: 新学校的设计图正在绘制中。

sentences.english: a course in food service and food preparation
sentences.chinese: 餐饮服务和备菜课程

detailed_translations.english: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

sentences.english: Prick the sausages before you grill them.
sentences.chinese: 烤之前把香肠戳孔。

detailed_translations.english: to make a small hole in something using something sharp
a  penis

name: compatible
trans: 能和睦相处的， 合得来的；兼容的

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

sentences.english: Check your spelling and grammar.
sentences.chinese: 检查你的拼写和语法。

sentences.english: the rules of English grammar
sentences.chinese: 英语的语法规则

sentences.english: A dictionary lists the words, a grammar states the rules.
sentences.chinese: 词典收列单词，语法书讲解语法规则。

detailed_translations.english: the rules by which words change their forms and are combined into sentences, or the study or use of these rules

name: critic
trans: 批评家， 评论家；批评， 评论

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: enable
trans: 使能够， 使成为可能

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

sentences.english: They have received notice of a typhoon approaching.
sentences.chinese: 他们已收到台风即将来临的预报。

sentences.english: We both are under stress and standing in the middle of a typhoon .
sentences.chinese: 你我都处在很紧张的环境中，站在台风的中心。

sentences.english: The football match have to stand over next week for the typhoon storm.
sentences.chinese: 由于台风风暴，这场足球赛延期到下个星期举行。

detailed_translations.english: a very violent tropical storm

name: dependent
trans: 依靠的， 依赖的； 从属的；随…而定的

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: profession
trans: 职业， 自由职业；公开表示

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

sentences.english: The UN deplored the invasion as a ‘violation of international law’.
sentences.chinese: 联合国谴责这次入侵 “违反了国际法” 。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谴责；悲悼；哀叹；对…深感遗憾
detailed_translations.english: to disapprove of something very strongly and criticize it severely, especially publicly

sentences.english: The zip on my skirt had broken.
sentences.chinese: 我裙子上的拉链坏了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拉链；活力，精力；尖啸声，撕裂声；一种程序压缩的档案文件格式
detailed_translations.english: two lines of small metal or plastic pieces that slide together to fasten a piece of clothing

detailed_translations.chinese: 拉开或拉上；以尖啸声行进
detailed_translations.english: to fasten something using a zip

sentences.english: Light silk is best for parachutes, as it compresses well and then expands rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 轻质丝绸最适合制作降落伞，因为这种面料便于压缩，而且展开迅速。

sentences.english: Isobel nodded, her lips compressed.
sentences.chinese: 伊索贝尔紧闭着双唇点了点头。

sentences.english: The miners used rock drills and compressed air to drive through hard rock.
sentences.chinese: 矿工使用钻岩机和压缩空气来凿穿坚硬的岩石。

detailed_translations.english: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller
a small thick piece of material that you put on part of someone’s body to stop blood flowing out or to make it less painful

name: arise
trans: 出现， 发生；由…引起， 由…产生 A

sentences.english: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

sentences.english: In marriage, a man promises to cherish his wife.
sentences.chinese: 在婚姻中，男人承诺要爱护妻子。

sentences.english: his most cherished possession
sentences.chinese: 他最珍爱的物品

detailed_translations.english: to love someone or something very much and take care of them well

name: imagination
trans: 想象， 空想； 想象力

sentences.english: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者

sentences.english: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
sentences.chinese: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。

sentences.english: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
sentences.chinese: 稍微动点脑筋，你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

sentences.english: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这些人确实存在，他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

name: resistance
trans: 抵抗， 反抗； 抵抗力， 阻力；电阻

sentences.english: Rebel gunmen have put up strong resistance.
sentences.chinese: 持枪的叛乱分子负隅顽抗。

sentences.english: disease resistance
sentences.chinese: 抗病能力

detailed_translations.english: fighting against someone who is attacking you

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

sentences.english: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他下车往底下看了看。

sentences.english: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
sentences.chinese: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。

sentences.english: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 她穿了件时髦的夹克，里面是一件 T 恤衫。

sentences.english: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
sentences.chinese: 一顶棒球帽裹住了她的满头金发。

sentences.english: He has on his jeans and a long-sleeved blue denim shirt with a white T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿牛仔裤和一件蓝色长袖粗斜纹棉布衬衫，里面还有件白色T恤衫。

sentences.english: The shooting-range is lit from underneath by rows of ruby-red light fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 射击场被一排排宝石红照明装置从下面照亮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下
detailed_translations.english: directly under another object or covered by it
Underneath is also an adverb
the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else

sentences.english: A modification of the common-origin theory accounts for the density discrepancy .
sentences.chinese: 关于共同起源的理论，有一种改进的论点解释了密度的不符。

detailed_translations.english: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same

sentences.english: She puts her baby in this nursery and then goes back to work.
sentences.chinese: 她把孩子送到这家托儿所然后回去上班。

sentences.english: The garden, developed over the past 35 years, includes a nursery.
sentences.chinese: 这个有35年历史的花园里有一个苗圃。

detailed_translations.english: a place where young children are taken care of during the day while their parents are at work

name: spectrum
trans: 【物】谱； 光谱； 【电信】频谱；范围， 幅度

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

sentences.english: They  bowed before the emperor as he entered the court.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝进入朝廷时他们都向他鞠躬致敬。

sentences.english: The daughter of an emperor does not worry about finding a husband.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝女儿不愁嫁。

sentences.english: The old chancellor who had offended against the emperor was relegated to the distant boundaries of the country.
sentences.chinese: 触犯了皇帝的老宰相被流放到遥远的边疆。

detailed_translations.english: the man who is the ruler of an empire

sentences.english: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

sentences.english: heart valves
sentences.chinese: 心脏瓣膜

detailed_translations.english: a part of a tube or pipe that opens and shuts like a door to control the flow of liquid, gas, air etc passing through it

name: favorite
trans: 特别喜欢的， 中意的

sentences.english: It is one of my favorite novels.
sentences.chinese: 这是我最喜爱的一本小说。

sentences.english: This anemone is one of my favorite plants.
sentences.chinese: 这朵银莲花是我最喜爱的植物之一。

sentences.english: His favorite fruits and vegetables as well as 55 lb. of bamboo will be on board for nourishment.
sentences.chinese: 除了它最喜爱的水果和蔬菜以外还有55磅的竹子将会作为它在飞机上的食物。

name: refund
trans: 退还， 偿还； 退款

sentences.english: They refused to give me a refund .
sentences.chinese: 他们拒绝给我退款。

sentences.english: Return your purchase within 14 days for a full refund .
sentences.chinese: 14 天之内退货可以全额退款。

sentences.english: You should go down there and demand a refund.
sentences.chinese: 你应该到那里去，要求退款。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for
to give someone their money back, especially because they are not satisfied with the goods or services they have paid for

sentences.english: The dream had distressed her greatly.
sentences.chinese: 这场梦使她深感不安。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very upset

name: remnant
trans: 残余物； 零头布料；遗迹

sentences.english: Beneath the present church were remnants of Roman flooring.
sentences.chinese: 在目前的这座教堂下面还有残余的古罗马地板。

detailed_translations.english: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

sentences.english: I thumbed a lift into town.
sentences.chinese: 我拦顺路车进了城。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade a driver of a passing car to stop and take you somewhere, by putting your hand out with your thumb raised
the part of your hand that is shaped like a thick short finger and helps you to hold things

sentences.english: The road became rocky and steep.
sentences.chinese: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。

sentences.english: a steep climb to the top
sentences.chinese: 到山顶的一段陡坡

sentences.english: steep cuts in benefits
sentences.chinese: 救济金的大幅度削减

detailed_translations.english: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

name: privilege
trans: 特权， 优惠， 特许
给予优惠， 给予特权

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

name: blaze
trans: 燃烧， 冒火焰；照耀， 发光
火焰； 火光；闪光， 光辉

sentences.english: Some 4,000 firefighters are battling the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 约有四千名消防人员正在与大火搏斗。

sentences.english: the blaze of light from the security lamps
sentences.chinese: 安全灯的强光

sentences.english: The room was warm, with a fire blazing in the hearth.
sentences.chinese: 房间里暖融融的，壁炉里的火熊熊燃烧。

detailed_translations.english: a big dangerous fire – used especially in news reports
to burn very brightly and strongly

name: moreover
trans: 再者， 加之， 而且

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

name: mysterious
trans: 神秘的， 可疑的； 难理解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: scatter
trans: 散开， 驱散；散布， 散播

sentences.english: The sound of gunfire made the crowd scatter in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 枪声使人群四散奔逃。

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people or animals scatter, or if something scatters them, they move quickly in different directions

sentences.english: 34 protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 34名抗议者因违反刑法而被逮捕。

sentences.english: regimes that violate human rights
sentences.chinese: 侵犯人权的政权

detailed_translations.english: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

sentences.english: He was steering with only one hand.
sentences.chinese: 他只用一只手在驾驶。

detailed_translations.english: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel

name: undergo
trans: 遭受； 经历； 承受

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: sympathize
trans: 同情， 体谅； 共鸣， 同感

sentences.english: I sympathize, but I don’t know how to help.
sentences.chinese: 我很同情，但不知道如何帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry for someone because you understand their problems

sentences.english: The computer crashed, and all our records were erased.
sentences.chinese: 计算机瘫痪了，我们所有的记录都被删除了。

detailed_translations.english: to remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape

sentences.english: The supplies were sent on the railroad.
sentences.chinese: 补给经由铁路运送。

sentences.english: a railroad station
sentences.chinese: 火车站

detailed_translations.english: a railway or the railway

name: agency
trans: 代理， 代办处； 机构

sentences.english: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
sentences.chinese: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构

sentences.english: the Environmental Protection Agency
sentences.chinese: 环保局

detailed_translations.english: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

name: coupon
trans: 礼券， 优惠券， 配给券；票证

sentences.english: The coupon entitles you to ten cents off your next purchase.
sentences.chinese: 这张优惠券可以让你在下次购物时节省10分钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 息票；赠券；联票；[经] 配给券
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free

sentences.english: I had never seen such a multitude of stars before.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从未见过这么多的星星。

sentences.english: a multitude of possible interpretations
sentences.chinese: 种种可能的解释

detailed_translations.english: a very large number of people or things

sentences.english: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

detailed_translations.english: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

sentences.english: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表
detailed_translations.english: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

sentences.english: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

detailed_translations.english: to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people

name: appearance
trans: 出现， 出场， 露面；外表， 外貌， 外观

sentences.english: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

sentences.english: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。

sentences.english: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。

sentences.english: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
sentences.chinese: 她表面上很镇静，内心却十分担忧。

sentences.english: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。

sentences.english: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
sentences.chinese: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。

sentences.english: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
sentences.chinese: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
sentences.chinese: 你不该以貌取人。

sentences.english: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学校里学习很用功，只是表面上并不显得特别如此。

sentences.english: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
sentences.chinese: 从所有迹象来看，这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。

sentences.english: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 这些学生看上去如天使一般，但外表可能是会骗人的。

sentences.english: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
sentences.chinese: 从各方面看，他都是个体面而成功的商人。

sentences.english: The industry has changed greatly with the appearance of new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 新技术问世后，这一行业出现了天翻地覆的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something looks to other people

name: liquid
trans: 液体的， 液态的 A

sentences.english: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在酱汁中再加一点水。

sentences.english: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
sentences.chinese: 儿童服用液态抗生素。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid

name: anonymous
trans: 匿名的， 无名的；无特色的

sentences.english: the anonymous author of a collection of poems
sentences.chinese: 一本诗集的佚名作者

sentences.english: According to one employee, who wishes to remain anonymous , the company engaged in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 根据一位不愿透露姓名的员工所述，这家公司曾从事非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: unknown by name

sentences.english: fake fur
sentences.chinese: 人造毛皮

sentences.english: a fake ID card
sentences.chinese: 假身份证

sentences.english: a fake 20 dollar bill
sentences.chinese: 一张20美元的伪钞

detailed_translations.english: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people
a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people

detailed_translations.chinese: 伪造， 捏造； 伪装
detailed_translations.english: to make something seem real in order to deceive people

sentences.english: The Algarve is a paradise for fishermen whether river anglers or deep-sea fishermen.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔加维对河边的垂钓者或深海的渔民都是一个天堂。

detailed_translations.english: someone who catches fish as a sport or as a job

name: span
trans: 跨度， 跨距； 范围

sentences.english: I worked with him over a span of six years.
sentences.chinese: 我和他共事达六年之久。

sentences.english: The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
sentences.chinese: 河上的桥为单跨桥。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: poll
trans: 民意测验；政治选举， 大选
对…进行民意测验；获得…选票

sentences.english: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.english: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.chinese: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.english: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.chinese: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.english: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.chinese: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民意测验；政治选举，大选
detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
detailed_translations.english: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

name: minority
trans: 少数， 少数派； 少数民族

sentences.english: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people or things within a much larger group

sentences.english: Her movements were graceful and elegant.
sentences.chinese: 她举手投足优雅而高贵。

sentences.english: The branches formed a graceful curve.
sentences.chinese: 那些树枝形成一条优美的曲线。

detailed_translations.english: moving in a smooth and attractive way, or having an attractive shape or form

name: preferable
trans: 更可取的， 较适合的， 更好的

sentences.english: Anything was preferable to the tense atmosphere at home.
sentences.chinese: 什么都比家里的紧张气氛好。

sentences.english: In warm weather, clothes made of natural fabrics are infinitely preferable (= much better ) .
sentences.chinese: 天气暖和的时候，穿天然织物的衣服要舒适得多。

detailed_translations.english: better or more suitable

name: reference
trans: 提及， 涉及 A；参考； 参考书目；证明书； 介绍

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

sentences.english: There were many conspiracy theories (= beliefs that something is the result of a conspiracy ) surrounding Princess Diana’s death.
sentences.chinese: 围绕戴安娜王妃之死有许多阴谋论。

detailed_translations.english: a secret plan made by two or more people to do something that is harmful or illegal

sentences.english: a combustion chamber
sentences.chinese: 燃烧室

sentences.english: The heart has four chambers.
sentences.chinese: 心脏有四个腔。

detailed_translations.chinese: （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所
detailed_translations.english: an enclosed space, especially in your body or inside a machine

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关在室内；装填（弹药等）

sentences.english: We went out in spite of the rain.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下着雨，我们还是出去了。

sentences.english: Kelly loved her husband in spite of the fact that he drank too much.
sentences.chinese: 虽然丈夫酗酒，凯莉仍然爱着他。

sentences.english: She broke it just out of spite.
sentences.chinese: 她就是出于恶意把它打破的。

sentences.english: The neighbours throw things over the garden wall just to spite us.
sentences.chinese: 邻居把东西扔过花园围墙，故意和我们作对。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or prevented by something
to deliberately annoy or upset someone

sentences.english: The tadpole has become a frog.
sentences.chinese: 这个蝌蚪已长成青蛙。

sentences.english: A tadpole metamorphoses into a frog.
sentences.chinese: 蝌蚪会变成青蛙。

sentences.english: The frog darted out its tongue to catch a mosquito.
sentences.chinese: 这只青蛙突然伸出舌头捕捉蚊子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 青蛙；[铁路] 辙叉；饰扣
detailed_translations.english: a small green animal that lives near water and has long legs for jumping

name: arrange
trans: 整理， 排列， 布置 A；安排， 筹备

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

sentences.english: I am planning a 25th birthday party for my nephew.
sentences.chinese: 我正在为侄子筹划他25岁的生日聚会。

detailed_translations.english: the son of your brother or sister, or the son of your husband’s or wife’s brother or sister

name: publicity
trans: 宣传， 宣扬；公众的注意， 名声

sentences.english: Much advance publicity was given to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 会谈之前做了大量的宣传。

sentences.english: ...government publicity campaigns.
sentences.chinese: …政府的宣传活动。

detailed_translations.english: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

sentences.english: Flights by Air Europe depart Gatwick on Tuesdays.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲航空公司的航班每逢周二从盖特威克机场起飞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离开；出发，起程；违反；去世
detailed_translations.english: to leave, especially when you are starting a journey

sentences.english: He has been studying archeology these thirty years.
sentences.chinese: 他这三十年来一直在研究考古学。

sentences.english: He was an expert in agriculture archeology, and medicine.
sentences.chinese: 他是农业考古学的专家， 和药。

sentences.english: She's giving a paper on archeology at the National Museum this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午她将在国家博物馆宣读一篇关于考古学的论文。

name: invariable
trans: 始终如一的， 不变的； 恒定的

sentences.english: Eluding is the invariable game.
sentences.chinese: 逃避是不变的游戏。

sentences.english: It is an invariable rule of auto design and engineering: Cars get bigger with age.
sentences.chinese: 汽车设计与工程领域里有条不变的法则：越是新出的车越大。

sentences.english: There's always, and I think this is nearly invariable -there's an element in Milton's similes that stands outside the framework of the basic comparison.
sentences.chinese: 有一点是时常出现并且几乎不变的,-就是在弥尔顿的明喻中始终有一个元素,是从基本的对比框架中脱颖而出的。

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

sentences.english: ...a garden spade.
sentences.chinese: …一把花园里使用的锹。

detailed_translations.english: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground

sentences.english: One of the nurses poked her head around the door.
sentences.chinese: 其中一名护士从门里探出头来。

detailed_translations.english: to move or push something through a space or opening

detailed_translations.chinese: 戳，捅；用…戳，把…戳向；伸出，突出
detailed_translations.english: to quickly push your finger or some other pointed object into something or someone
to quickly push your fingers, a stick etc into something or someone

sentences.english: light fixtures
sentences.chinese: 照明设备

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that is fixed inside a house or building and is sold as part of the house

sentences.english: Two people were killed in a head-on collision (= between two vehicles that are moving directly towards each other ) on highway 218.
sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

sentences.english: a collision between the two countries over fishing rights
sentences.chinese: 两国为捕鱼权而发生的冲突

detailed_translations.english: an accident in which two or more people or vehicles hit each other while moving in different directions

name: manufacture
trans: 制造， 制造业； 产品

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

sentences.english: A potato has about 90 calories.
sentences.chinese: 一个马铃薯大约有90卡路里的热量。

sentences.english: a calorie-controlled diet
sentences.chinese: 控制热量的日常饮食

sentences.english: I need to burn off a few calories (= lose some weight by exercising ) .
sentences.chinese: 我要消耗掉一些卡路里。

sentences.english: My wife convinced me to finally start counting calories (= control my weight by being careful about what I eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 我妻子终于说服我开始计算卡路里、控制体重。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the amount of  energy  that food will produce

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

sentences.english: an advertising slogan
sentences.chinese: 一句广告口号

sentences.english: demonstrators shouting political slogans
sentences.chinese: 高喊政治口号的示威者

sentences.english: the Democrats’ campaign slogan
sentences.chinese: 民主党的竞选口号

detailed_translations.english: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc

sentences.english: She cradled the child to her bosom.
sentences.chinese: 她把那孩子抱入怀中。

sentences.english: They were bosom buddies.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾是知心的伙伴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胸；胸怀；中间；胸襟；内心；乳房；内部
detailed_translations.english: the front part of a woman’s chest
A bosom buddy is a friend who you know very well and like very much

sentences.english: The path descends to  the pond.
sentences.chinese: 小路下斜通到池塘。

sentences.english: This pond often catches in winter.
sentences.chinese: 这个池塘在冬天常常结冰。

sentences.english: Wild flowers and grasses rimmed the little pond.
sentences.chinese: 各种野花和野草环绕着这个小池塘。

detailed_translations.english: a small area of fresh water that is smaller than a lake, that is either natural or artificially made

name: steak
trans: 牛排； 肉排； 鱼排

sentences.english: ...a steak sizzling on the grill.
sentences.chinese: …一块儿在烤架上滋滋作响的牛排。

detailed_translations.english: good quality beef, or a large thick piece of any good quality red meat

sentences.english: He said that all metals were composed of mercury and sulphur in different proportions .
sentences.chinese: 他说一切金属都是由水银和硫黄按不同比例构成的。

sentences.english: Here they endure long hours at dangerous jobs, wringing flecks of gold from the dirt with mercury.
sentences.chinese: 他们每天在这种危险的环境下工作很长时间，从带有水银的泥沙中淘出金沙。

sentences.english: Because glass mercury thermometers harm both humans and the environment, they have been phased out and are no longer recommended.
sentences.chinese: 因为玻璃水银温度计对于人类和环境都有害处，现在已经逐步被淘汰不再建议使用了。

detailed_translations.english: Mercury is a silver-coloured liquid metal that is used especially in thermometers and barometers

name: interact
trans: 互相作用， 互相影响

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: membership
trans: 会员资格， 成员资格

sentences.english: You should carry your membership card with you at all times.
sentences.chinese: 你应该随身携带会员卡。

sentences.english: Membership fees are being increased this year.
sentences.chinese: 会费今年提高了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会员身份， 会籍； 全体会员， 会员数
detailed_translations.english: when someone is a member of a club, group, or organization

name: powder
trans: 粉末； 【医】药粉 A；火药； 炸药

sentences.english: curry powder
sentences.chinese: 咖喱粉

sentences.english: talcum powder
sentences.chinese: 滑石[爽身]粉

sentences.english: Grind the sugar into a powder .
sentences.chinese: 把糖碾成粉末。

sentences.english: The paint is supplied in powder form .
sentences.chinese: 这种涂料以粉末状供应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉；粉末；[化工][军] 火药；尘土
detailed_translations.english: a dry substance in the form of very small grains

name: error
trans: 错误， 过失； 误差

sentences.english: There must be an error in our calculations.
sentences.chinese: 我们的计算肯定有错。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake

name: network
trans: 网状物；广播网， 电视网；网络 A

sentences.english: Hungary’s telephone network
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利的电话网

sentences.english: a high-speed European rail network
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的高速铁路网

sentences.english: the network of blood vessels in the body
sentences.chinese: 人体内的血管网

detailed_translations.english: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

name: jealous
trans: 妒忌的；珍惜的， 爱惜的

sentences.english: She got insanely jealous and there was a terrible fight.
sentences.chinese: 她变得过分地猜忌，接着是一场激烈的打斗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

sentences.english: seemingly unrelated bits of information
sentences.chinese: 似乎互不相关的零星信息

detailed_translations.english: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

sentences.english: There were large patches of rust on the car.
sentences.chinese: 车上有大片锈斑。

sentences.english: The metal had begun to rust.
sentences.chinese: 金属开始生锈。

detailed_translations.english: the reddish-brown substance that forms on iron or steel when it gets wet
to become covered with rust, or to make something become covered in rust

name: attendant
trans: 伴随的， 随之而生的
服务员， 值班员； 护理人员

sentences.english: a cloakroom/parking/museum attendant
sentences.chinese: 衣帽间 / 停车服务员；博物馆接待员

sentences.english: The Prince was followed by his attendants.
sentences.chinese: 王子由其侍从陪同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侍者；（要人的）侍从；（病人的）护理人员
detailed_translations.english: a person whose job is to serve or help people in a public place

name: trace
trans: 痕迹， 踪迹；极少量， 微量

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

sentences.english: She was taken to hospital, suffering from pneumonia.
sentences.chinese: 她得了肺炎，被送往医院。

detailed_translations.english: a serious illness that affects your lungs and makes it difficult for you to breathe

name: array
trans: 一系列， 大量； 排列

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: endeavour
trans: 努力， 尽力； 力图
努力， 尽力； 力图

sentences.english: But I will endeavour to banish every painful thought, and think only of what will make me happy: your affection, and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt.
sentences.chinese: 可是我一定会竭力打消一切苦痛的念头，只去想一些能使我高兴的事───譬如想想你的亲切以及亲爱的舅父母对我始终如一的关切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）
detailed_translations.english: to try very hard

name: discriminate
trans: 区别， 辨别 <；有差别地对待， 歧视

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

sentences.english: For these reasons, the bank chose it as their development tool for their modernization project.
sentences.chinese: 出于这些理由，银行选择它作为其现代化项目的开发工具。

sentences.english: We must achieve modernization of science and technology, otherwise we will lag behind other nations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须实现科学技术现代化，否则我们要落后于其他国家。

name: repay
trans: 付还， 偿还；报答， 回报

sentences.english: Your mortgage will be repaid over 25 years.
sentences.chinese: 你的按揭贷款将在25年内还清。

sentences.english: I’d like to buy them something to repay all their kindness.
sentences.chinese: 我想给他们买点东西来报答他们的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to pay back money that you have borrowed

sentences.english: the government’s tight monetary policy
sentences.chinese: 政府从紧的货币政策

sentences.english: objects of little monetary value
sentences.chinese: 不值钱的物件

detailed_translations.english: relating to money, especially all the money in a particular country

sentences.english: We’re staying at the Holiday Inn.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在假日酒店。

detailed_translations.english: a small hotel or pub, especially an old one in the countryside

name: performance
trans: 履行， 执行；表演， 演出；性能， 特性

sentences.english: This evening’s performance will begin at 8.00 pm.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的演出8点开始。

sentences.english: the performance of his official duties
sentences.chinese: 履行他的职务

sentences.english: Sean’s performance at school has greatly improved.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩在学校的表现进步很大。

detailed_translations.english: when someone performs a play or a piece of music

name: serial
trans: 连续的， 按顺序排列的

sentences.english: Keep the questions in the same serial order .
sentences.chinese: 让这些问题保持原来的顺序。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连续的；连载的；分期偿还的
detailed_translations.english: arranged or happening one after the other in the correct order

detailed_translations.chinese: 电视连续剧；[图情] 期刊；连载小说
detailed_translations.english: a story that is broadcast or printed in several separate parts on television, in a magazine etc

sentences.english: the US ambassador to Spain
sentences.chinese: 美国驻西班牙大使

detailed_translations.english: an important official who represents his or her government in a foreign country

name: growth
trans: 生长； 增长； 发展

sentences.english: measures to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 刺激经济增长的措施

detailed_translations.english: an increase in amount, number, or size

sentences.english: a comic novel
sentences.chinese: 滑稽小说

detailed_translations.english: amusing you and making you want to laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物
detailed_translations.english: a magazine for children that tells a story using comic strips

sentences.english: hand-woven scarves
sentences.chinese: 手织围巾

sentences.english: Only a few of the women still weave.
sentences.chinese: 只有数量很少的妇女还在编织。

sentences.english: traditional basket weaving
sentences.chinese: 传统的编篮技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回行进；编织；编造，编纂
detailed_translations.english: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom
the way in which a material is woven, and the pattern formed by this

sentences.english: The Pope will visit El Salvador this year.
sentences.chinese: 教皇今年将访问萨尔瓦多。

sentences.english: Pope John XXIII
sentences.chinese: 教皇约翰二十三世

detailed_translations.english: the leader of the Roman Catholic Church

name: vague
trans: 不明确的， 含糊的； 暧昧的

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

sentences.english: It is unlikely that the marine industry will fare any better in September.
sentences.chinese: 海运业不大可能在9月份有所好转。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone or something fares well or badly, you are referring to the degree of success they achieve in a particular situation or activity
the price you pay to travel somewhere by bus, train, plane etc

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

name: psychiatry
trans: 精神病学；精神病治疗法

sentences.english: In it, he argued that psychiatry was a branch of medical science and should be investigated by observation and experimentation like the other natural sciences.
sentences.chinese: 在书中，他主张精神病学是医学的一个分支，应当像其他自然科学一样以观察和实验为研究手段。

detailed_translations.english: the study and treatment of mental illnesses

name: resolution
trans: 坚决， 决心 A；决定， 决议

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

sentences.english: Spouses were invited to the company picnic.
sentences.chinese: 配偶受到邀请参加公司的野餐会。

detailed_translations.english: a husband or wife

name: setting
trans: 落山；底座；环境； 背景

sentences.english: I’ve worked with children in various settings, mainly in secondary school.
sentences.chinese: 我在许多地方教过孩子，主要是在中学。

sentences.english: The heating system was already on its highest setting.
sentences.chinese: 取暖系统已经调到了最高挡。

detailed_translations.english: the place where something is or where something happens, and the general environment

name: score
trans: 得分， 分数；二十 A <

sentences.english: At half-time the score was one all.
sentences.chinese: 半场时的比分是一比一。

sentences.english: What’s the score?
sentences.chinese: 比分是多少？

sentences.english: Is anybody keeping score (= making a record of the score ) ?
sentences.chinese: 有没有人负责记分？

sentences.english: The final score was Southampton two, Leeds United nil.
sentences.chinese: 最后的比分是二比零，南安普敦队击败利兹联队。

sentences.english: The school’s test scores have not improved.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的考试成绩没有提高。

detailed_translations.english: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

sentences.english: the British Isles
sentences.chinese: 不列颠群岛

detailed_translations.english: a word for an island, used in poetry or in names of islands

sentences.english: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。

sentences.english: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
sentences.chinese: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话，说边境地区现在很安全。

sentences.english: They quoted a price of £15,000.
sentences.chinese: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

sentences.english: a graduate student
sentences.chinese: 研究生

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involved in studies done at a university after completing a first degree
to obtain a degree, especially a first degree, from a college or university
someone who has completed a university degree, especially a first degree

name: quota
trans: 定额， 限额， 配额

sentences.english: The government has decided to scrap quotas on car imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定取消汽车进口配额。

sentences.english: There are plans to introduce strict immigration quotas.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要推行严格的移民限额制度。

detailed_translations.english: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

name: unanimous
trans: 全体一致的， 一致同意的

sentences.english: It was decided by a unanimous vote that the school should close.
sentences.chinese: 关闭学校是大家一致通过的决定。

sentences.english: The decision to appoint Matt was almost unanimous.
sentences.chinese: 任命马特的决定几乎是一致通过的。

detailed_translations.english: a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree

name: thermal
trans: 热的， 由热造成的；保暖的

sentences.english: thermal energy
sentences.chinese: 热能

detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by heat
a rising current of warm air used by birds

sentences.english: Researchers greeted the proposal with scorn.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们对这个提议报以轻蔑的态度。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that someone or something is stupid or does not deserve respect

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻蔑， 鄙视； 拒绝， 不屑
detailed_translations.english: to show that you think that something is stupid, unreasonable, or not worth accepting

sentences.english: But no one knew where the sulfur came from.
sentences.chinese: 但是，没有人知道硫来自何处。

sentences.english: Well, this chlorine has taken one electron from the sulfur.
sentences.chinese: 对了，这个氯从硫那里得到了一个电子。

sentences.english: These pollutants are called aerosols and they include soot as well as compounds of nitrogen and sulfur and other stuff into the air.
sentences.chinese: 通常，我们称这些污染物为悬浮微粒，它们包含烟尘以及氮硫与进入大气的其他物质的混合物。

sentences.english: He was wiping his hands on an oily rag.
sentences.chinese: 他正用一块油腻腻的抹布擦手。

detailed_translations.english: A rag is a piece of old cloth which you can use to clean or wipe things
to laugh at someone or play tricks on them

name: grief
trans: 悲伤， 悲痛；悲伤的事； 悲痛的缘由

sentences.english: The grief she felt over Helen’s death was almost unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 她因海伦的去世而悲痛难当。

detailed_translations.english: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

name: ashamed
trans: 羞耻的， 惭愧的， 害臊的

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

name: rap
trans: 敲击， 急敲；责备， 训斥
敲击， 急敲；说唱音乐

sentences.english: ‘Come on,’ he rapped impatiently.
sentences.chinese: “得了吧。”他不耐烦地厉声说道。

detailed_translations.english: to say the words of a rap song

detailed_translations.chinese: 敲击，急敲；突然厉声说出；责备，训斥
detailed_translations.english: to say something loudly, suddenly, and in a way that sounds angry
a series of quick sharp hits or knocks

name: unlikely
trans: 未必的； 不可能的； 靠不住的

sentences.english: Donna might be able to come tomorrow, but it’s very unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 唐娜明天也许能来，不过这可能性很小。

detailed_translations.english: not likely to happen

sentences.english: This was demonstrated in a laboratory experiment with rats.
sentences.chinese: 这点通过在实验室中用老鼠做试验得到证明。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that looks like a large mouse with a long tail

sentences.english: See Appendix 2.6.
sentences.chinese: 见附录2.6。

sentences.english: Christine had to go into hospital to have her appendix out (=  have it removed  ) .
sentences.chinese: 克里丝蒂娜不得不去医院切除阑尾。

detailed_translations.english: a part at the end of a book containing additional information

name: handwriting
trans: 笔迹， 手迹， 书法

sentences.english: I recognised her handwriting on the envelope.
sentences.chinese: 我认出了信封上她的笔迹。

sentences.english: My handwriting has never been very neat.
sentences.chinese: 我的字从来都写得不够工整。

detailed_translations.english: the style of someone’s writing

name: raw
trans: 未煮过的， 生的；未加工过的；未经训练的

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: grated raw carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的生胡萝卜

sentences.english: Cabbage can be eaten raw.
sentences.chinese: 洋白菜可以生吃。

sentences.english: raw sugar
sentences.chinese: 原糖

detailed_translations.english: not cooked

sentences.english: Sprinkle the meat with salt and place in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 给肉撒点盐，然后放进平锅里。

detailed_translations.english: to scatter small drops of liquid or small pieces of something
a small amount of something, especially scattered on top of something

sentences.english: the castle courtyard
sentences.chinese: 城堡的庭院

detailed_translations.english: an open space that is completely or partly surrounded by buildings

sentences.english: people of the same nationality
sentences.chinese: 同国籍的人

sentences.english: the different nationalities within the former USSR
sentences.chinese: 前苏联的各个民族

detailed_translations.english: the state of being legally a citizen of a particular country

name: municipal
trans: 市的， 市政的， 市立的

sentences.english: the municipal waste dump
sentences.chinese: 城市垃圾场

sentences.english: municipal elections
sentences.chinese: 市级选举

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

name: institute
trans: 设立， 设置， 制定
学会， 研究所， 学院

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: endure
trans: 忍受， 容忍 <；持久， 持续

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: poster
trans: 招贴， 海报， 广告

sentences.english: A team of volunteers were putting up posters .
sentences.chinese: 一队志愿者正在张贴海报。

sentences.english: a poster campaign for the election
sentences.chinese: 选举的海报宣传

detailed_translations.english: a large printed notice, picture, or photograph, used to advertise something or as a decoration

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

detailed_translations.english: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

sentences.english: the criteria we use to select candidates
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选候选人的标准

detailed_translations.english: a standard that you use to judge something or make a decision about something

sentences.english: The singer complained of a sore throat after Wednesday’s show.
sentences.chinese: 星期三演出后，这位歌手说喉咙痛。

detailed_translations.english: the passage from the back of your mouth to the top of the tubes that go down to your lungs and stomach

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

name: manual
trans: 手的； 手工做的； 体力的

sentences.english: People in manual occupations have a lower life expectancy.
sentences.chinese: 干体力活的人预期寿命较短。

detailed_translations.english: manual work involves using your hands or your physical strength rather than your mind

name: maneuver
trans: 演习；谨慎地运用技巧移动， 运动；熟练而巧妙地引导某人

sentences.english: The chopper shot upward in a manoeuver matched by the other pilot.
sentences.chinese: 这架直升飞机向上冲去，另一架飞机也以相同的移动方向冲了上去。

sentences.english: The president has tried to manoeuver the campaign away from himself.
sentences.chinese: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。
