detailed_translations.english: a very fast speed

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
detailed_translations.english: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

name: appoint
trans: 任命， 委任；约定， 指定

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for a position or a job

name: vast
trans: 巨大的； 辽阔的； 大量的；巨额的

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: intervene
trans: 插手， 干预， 调停；插入， 介入

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

sentences.english: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹引起了一场火灾，烧毁了大约六十间房屋。

detailed_translations.english: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes
to start burning, or to make something start burning

sentences.english: The symbol on the packet is a guarantee that the food has been produced organically.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上的这个标识保证这种食物是有机生产的。

sentences.english: Fe is the chemical symbol for iron.
sentences.chinese: Fe是铁的化学符号。

detailed_translations.english: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea

name: declare
trans: 宣布， 宣称；断言；公布， 发表， 披露

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

name: revelation
trans: 揭示， 透露， 显示； 被揭示的真相； 新发现

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

name: available
trans: 可用的， 可得到的；可以见到的， 随时可来的

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: advocate
trans: 提倡者， 鼓吹者， 支持者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: confine
trans: 限制， 局限于；管制， 禁闭

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

sentences.english: He had been questing for religious belief from an early age.
sentences.chinese: 他从早年开始就一直在寻求宗教信仰。

sentences.english: ...his questing mind and boundless enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: …他的探索型头脑和无限的热情

detailed_translations.english: to search for sth that is difficult to find

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

sentences.english: a horizontal surface
sentences.chinese: 水平面

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平的；地平线的；同一阶层的
detailed_translations.english: flat and level

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平线，水平面；水平位置
detailed_translations.english: a horizontal line or surface

sentences.english: They searched his luggage for illegal drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他们搜查他的行李看是否藏有毒品。

detailed_translations.english: the cases, bags etc that you carry when you are travelling

sentences.english: It’s a great city – the only drawback is the weather.
sentences.chinese: 这是座很不错的城市，唯一的不足就是天气。

detailed_translations.english: a disadvantage of a situation, plan, product etc

sentences.english: a nuclear missile
sentences.chinese: 核导弹

sentences.english: a missile attack
sentences.chinese: 导弹袭击

detailed_translations.english: a weapon that can fly over long distances and that explodes when it hits the thing it has been aimed at

detailed_translations.chinese: 导弹的；可投掷的；用以发射导弹的

name: dynamic
trans: 动力的， 电动的；有生气的

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

name: sector
trans: 部分； 部门；防御地段， 防区；扇形

sentences.english: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.
sentences.chinese: …该国的制造部门。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

name: passion
trans: 热情， 激情； 酷爱；激怒， 大怒

sentences.english: The issue arouses strong passions.
sentences.chinese: 那件事激起了人们强烈的情绪。

sentences.english: Gardening was her great passion.
sentences.chinese: 她酷爱园艺。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的情感，激情；强烈的爱好，热爱
detailed_translations.english: a very strong belief or feeling about something

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: extreme
trans: 末端的， 尽头的；极度的， 极端的

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

sentences.english: You tuck your secret away in an unexpected place, like an MP3 or a photo file, to conceal the fact you even shared any information at all.
sentences.chinese: 你将你的秘密“卷起来”，放在一个意想不到的地方，比如MP3或照片文件，这样就掩盖了你曾经分享信息的事实。

detailed_translations.english: a pleat or fold in a part of a garment, usually stitched down so as to make it a better fit or as decoration

name: coordinate
trans: 同等的； 并列的 A；坐标的

sentences.english: Matching bag and accessories provide a complete ensemble of colour coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 颜色协调的包和饰品使全套服装的颜色搭配齐全了。

detailed_translations.english: one of a set of numbers which give the exact position of a point on a map, computer screen etc
equal in importance or rank in a sentence
to organize an activity so that the people involved in it work well together and achieve a good result

sentences.english: a professional athlete
sentences.chinese: 一位专业运动员

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in sports competitions, especially running, jumping, and throwing

sentences.english: The book treats of astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是讲天文学的。

sentences.english: This was the birth of astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 这就是天文学的起源。

sentences.english: You could study astronomy , or space engineering , and be good at it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以学习天文学，或是空间工程学，可以学的很棒。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the stars and  planet s

name: tube
trans: 管， 软管；电子管， 显像管； 电视；地铁

sentences.english: a tube of toothpaste
sentences.chinese: 一管牙膏

detailed_translations.english: a round pipe made of metal, glass, rubber etc, especially for liquids or gases to go through

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成管状；把…装管；用管输送

sentences.english: a naval officer
sentences.chinese: 海军军官

sentences.english: naval battles
sentences.chinese: 海战

detailed_translations.english: relating to the navy or used by the navy

name: dismay
trans: 惊恐， 惊愕；失望， 绝望
使惊恐， 使惊愕；失望， 绝望

sentences.english: The thought of leaving filled him with dismay .
sentences.chinese: 想到要离开，他心里充满了忧伤。

sentences.english: The committee was dismayed by what it had been told.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会被所告知的情况搞得焦虑不安。

detailed_translations.english: the worry, disappoint-ment, or unhappiness you feel when something unpleasant happens
If you are dismayed by something, it makes you feel afraid, worried, or sad

sentences.english: Children expend a lot of energy and may need more high-energy food than adults.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们耗能多，可能比成人需要更多高能量的食物。

detailed_translations.english: to use or spend a lot of energy etc in order to do something

name: hint
trans: 暗示， 提示； 线索

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

name: demonstrate
trans: 论证， 证实；展示， 说明 <

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

sentences.english: She’d always loved animals since she was a little kid.
sentences.chinese: 她从小就喜爱动物。

sentences.english: He’s married with three kids.
sentences.chinese: 他已婚，有三个孩子。

sentences.english: A neighbor volunteered to keep an eye on the kids (= their children or the children they are responsible for ).
sentences.chinese: 一位邻居主动来照看这些小孩。

sentences.english: college kids
sentences.chinese: 大学生

detailed_translations.english: a child

sentences.english: He is next in line to the throne (= will become king when the present ruler dies ) .
sentences.chinese: 他是第一王位继承人。

sentences.english: In 1913, George V was on the throne (= was ruling ) .
sentences.chinese: 1913年乔治五世在位。

detailed_translations.english: the position and power of being a king or queen

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: inventory
trans: 详细目录；存货清单， 物品清单， 库存物品

sentences.english: ...one inventory of twelve sails for each yacht.
sentences.chinese: …为每艘游艇配备12张帆的存货。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细目录， 存货清单
detailed_translations.english: a list of all the things in a place

name: vivid
trans: 鲜艳的；生动的， 栩栩如生的

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

name: kin
trans: 家属； 亲戚； 血缘关系 A；家族

sentences.english: We’ll have to notify the next of kin of his death.
sentences.chinese: 我们得把他去世的消息通知他的直系亲属。

detailed_translations.english: your family

sentences.english: Susan flushed deeply and looked away.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊脸涨得通红，目光转向别处。

sentences.english: He flushed angrily .
sentences.chinese: 他气得满脸通红。

detailed_translations.english: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed
if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat

name: manoeuvre
trans: 演习；谨慎地运用技巧移动， 运动；熟练而巧妙地引导某人

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

sentences.english: I manoeuvred my way among the tables to the back corner of the place.
sentences.chinese: 我在那些桌子间穿行，来到那地方后面的角落。

detailed_translations.english: If you manoeuvre something into or out of an awkward position, you skilfully move it there
a skilful or carefully planned action intended to gain an advantage for yourself

name: kit
trans: 成套工具； 配套元件

sentences.english: Sally keeps her make-up kit in her bag.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉把化妆包放在手提包里。

sentences.english: a bike repair kit
sentences.chinese: 一套自行车修理工具

sentences.english: a shaving kit
sentences.chinese: 一套剃须用具

sentences.english: a drum kit
sentences.chinese: 一套架子鼓

detailed_translations.english: a set of tools, equipment etc that you use for a particular purpose or activity

name: virtue
trans: 美德， 德行；优点， 长处 A <

sentences.english: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

sentences.english: Wilkins is now extolling the virtues of organic farming.
sentences.chinese: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

detailed_translations.english: moral goodness of character and behaviour

name: turnover
trans: 翻倒， 翻转；人员调整；周转；成交量， 营业额

sentences.english: The company had a turnover of $3.8 million.
sentences.chinese: 那个公司拥有380万美元的营业额。

detailed_translations.chinese: 营业额， 成交量； 人员调整， 人员更替率
detailed_translations.english: the amount of business done during a particular period

name: mortal
trans: 致命的；终有一死的 A；你死我活的， 不共戴天的

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

sentences.english: There has been a gradual change in climate.
sentences.chinese: 气候渐渐发生了变化。

sentences.english: the gradual decline in manufacturing industry
sentences.chinese: 制造业的逐渐衰退

sentences.english: Education is a gradual process.
sentences.chinese: 教育是一个循序渐进的过程。

detailed_translations.english: happening slowly over a long period of time

name: brutal
trans: 残忍的；严峻的， 严酷的

sentences.english: a brutal man
sentences.chinese: 一个凶残的男人

detailed_translations.english: very cruel and violent

sentences.english: rules that preclude experimentation in teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 禁止进行教学方法试验的规定

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something or make something impossible

sentences.english: Young prisoners are being corrupted by the older, long-term offenders.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.english: Corrupt judges have taken millions of dollars in bribes.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的法官接受了几百万美元的贿赂。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way
using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

name: transmit
trans: 传播， 发射；传递； 传导

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

sentences.english: a parade to commemorate the town’s bicentenary
sentences.chinese: 庆祝该镇建立200周年的游行

detailed_translations.english: to do something to show that you remember and respect someone important or an important event in the past

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

sentences.english: The systems are getting smaller and using lower voltages.
sentences.chinese: 这些系统正变得更小而且使用更低的电压。

detailed_translations.english: electrical force measured in volts

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

sentences.english: She made periodical visits to her dentist.
sentences.chinese: 她定期去看牙医。

detailed_translations.english: Periodical events or situations happen occasionally, at fairly regular intervals
a magazine, especially one about a serious or technical subject

name: leaflet
trans: 小叶， 嫩叶；传单， 活页

sentences.english: a leaflet on skin cancer
sentences.chinese: 有关皮肤癌的宣传页

sentences.english: Students were handing out election leaflets at the station.
sentences.chinese: 学生在车站分发选举传单。

detailed_translations.english: a small book or piece of paper advertising something or giving information on a particular subject

name: punctual
trans: 严守时刻的， 准时的， 正点的

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

sentences.english: They no longer advertise alcohol or cigarettes at sporting events.
sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.english: Colleges and universities have found that it pays to advertise (=  advertising brings good results  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大专院校发现做广告效果很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…做广告， 宣传； 公告； 登广告
detailed_translations.english: to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: shampoo
trans: 洗发膏， 香波；洗发， 洗头

sentences.english: What kind of shampoo do you use?
sentences.chinese: 你用的是哪种洗发水？

sentences.english: a bottle of shampoo
sentences.chinese: 一瓶香波

detailed_translations.english: a liquid soap for washing your hair
to wash something with shampoo

sentences.english: They’ve never actually given anyone the sack .
sentences.chinese: 他们从未真的辞退过什么人。

sentences.english: He got the sack for stealing.
sentences.chinese: 他因偷东西而被解雇。

sentences.english: She claimed she’d been threatened with the sack.
sentences.chinese: 她称自己受到过解雇的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is dismissed from their job
to dismiss someone from their job

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

sentences.english: a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe
sentences.chinese: 一头棕色直发、留着刘海的高个子女孩

sentences.english: The monarchists are a small fringe group who quarrel fiercely among themselves.
sentences.chinese: 君主制拥护者们是个边缘性小团体，内部争吵激烈。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead
Fringe groups or events are less important or popular than other related groups or events

name: react
trans: 作出反应， 回应 <；反对， 起反作用

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: justify
trans: 证明…是正当的， 认为有理

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

sentences.english: I think so. We certainly don't want a highjack to happen on the plane today.
sentences.chinese: 我想是的。我们当然不希望在今天的飞机上发生劫机事件。

sentences.english: B : I think so. We certainly don't want a highjack to happen on the plane today.
sentences.chinese: 我想是的。 我们当然不希望在今天的飞机上发生劫机事件。

name: roar
trans: 吼叫， 怒号 A；轰鸣； 咆哮

sentences.english: We heard a lion roar.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到狮子在吼叫。

sentences.english: The engines roared.
sentences.chinese: 引擎轰鸣。

sentences.english: ‘Get out of my house!’ he roared.
sentences.chinese: “从我家里滚出去！”他吼道。

sentences.english: the roar of the crowd
sentences.chinese: 人群的喊叫声

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep, very loud noise
a deep, loud noise made by an animal such as a lion, or by someone’s voice

sentences.english: a bench made of timber
sentences.chinese: 木制长椅

detailed_translations.english: wood used for building or making things

name: simulate
trans: 模仿， 模拟；假装， 冒充

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

name: inclusive
trans: 包括的， 包含的；范围广的

sentences.english: The fully inclusive fare for the trip is £22.
sentences.chinese: 这次出行的全部费用为22英镑。

sentences.english: The rent is £120 a week, inclusive of heating.
sentences.chinese: 房租连暖气费在内是每星期120英镑。

detailed_translations.english: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

sentences.english: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia
sentences.chinese: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

sentences.english: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines
sentences.chinese: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

name: overhead
trans: 在头顶上的； 架空的 A

sentences.english: Bullets whizzed overhead.
sentences.chinese: 子弹嗖嗖地掠过头顶。

sentences.english: A plane flew overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机从头顶飞过。

sentences.english: She turned on the overhead light and looked around the little room.
sentences.chinese: 她打开顶灯，环视这间小屋。

detailed_translations.english: above your head or in the sky
You use overhead to indicate that something is above you or above the place that you are talking about

detailed_translations.chinese: 经常费用， 管理费用
detailed_translations.english: money spent regularly on rent, insurance, electricity, and other things that are needed to keep a business operating

sentences.english: Why you let her talk you into doing such a foolish thing is beyond my comprehension (= impossible for me to understand ) .
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会被她说服去做这种蠢事，我实在是无法理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解， 理解力， 领悟； 理解力测验
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand something

name: intact
trans: 完整无缺的， 未经触动的， 未受损伤的

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

sentences.english: He was sick in the evening, but the following day he was better.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上他生病了，但第二天就好一些了。

sentences.english: Write down the following information: name of product, type, date purchased and price.
sentences.chinese: 写下以下信息：产品名称、型号、购买日期和价格。

detailed_translations.english: the next afternoon, month etc

name: juvenile
trans: 青少年的， 少年特有的； 幼稚的

sentences.english: juvenile crime
sentences.chinese: 少年犯罪

sentences.english: a juvenile court
sentences.chinese: 少年法院[法庭]

sentences.english: The number of juveniles in the general population has fallen by a fifth in the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的10年中，青少年在总人口中所占的比重下降了1/5。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少年的，少年特有的；幼稚的，不成熟的
detailed_translations.english: law relating to young people who are not yet adults
A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: freight
trans: 货物， 客货； 运费 <

sentences.english: freight services
sentences.chinese: 货运公司

sentences.english: We’ll send your personal belongings by air freight and your furniture by sea freight .
sentences.chinese: 你的个人物品我们将以空运方式运送，家具将以海运方式运送。

detailed_translations.english: goods that are carried by ship, train, or aircraft, and the system of moving these goods
to send goods by air, sea, or train

sentences.english: He studied botany at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学学习植物学。

sentences.english: To what degree are you interested in botany?
sentences.chinese: 你对植物学的兴趣达到什么程度?

sentences.english: The first of these in the field of botany were the herbals.
sentences.chinese: 在植物学领域，这些最早的著作是本草书。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of plants

name: range
trans: 范围； 距离； 领域 <；排列； 连续；脉

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

sentences.english: He’s a very keen sportsman .
sentences.chinese: 他是个非常喜爱运动的人。

sentences.english: a talented all-round sportsman
sentences.chinese: 一名有天赋的全能运动员

detailed_translations.english: a man who plays several different sports

name: derive
trans: 取得； 导出， 引申

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

sentences.english: Chris is going to work overseas.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯要去国外工作。

sentences.english: Most applications came from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 大部分申请来自海外。

detailed_translations.english: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: overhear
trans: 偶然听到， 从旁听到

sentences.english: I overheard part of their conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我碰巧听到了他们谈话的部分内容。

sentences.english: I couldn’t help overhearing your argument.
sentences.chinese: 我无意中听到了你们的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to accidentally hear what other people are saying, when they do not know that you have heard

name: impress
trans: 印， 盖印；留下印象， 引人注目 <

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

name: leak
trans: 漏洞， 漏隙；泄漏， 漏出

sentences.english: The roof is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶在漏水。

sentences.english: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰海岸附近有一艘油轮漏油。

sentences.english: 英语例句：The boat had sprung a leak (= a hole had appeared in it ).
sentences.chinese: 小船出现了漏洞。

detailed_translations.english: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

sentences.english: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.english: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.english: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.english: It's a great film and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year.
sentences.chinese: 那是一部精彩的电影，它由一位西班牙演员主演，他一年之内就会成为国际明星。

sentences.english: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games.
sentences.chinese: 这个一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍近期比赛的精彩部分。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片
detailed_translations.english: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

name: lean
trans: 倾斜； 屈身；倚， 靠； 依赖

sentences.english: They were leaning forward, facing each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们面对面身体前倾。

sentences.english: He was leaning on the bridge, watching the boats go by.
sentences.chinese: 他靠在桥上，看着船来船往。

detailed_translations.english: to move or bend your body in a particular direction

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

sentences.english: The festival reaches its climax with the traditional boat-burning ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 传统的烧船仪式将节庆活动推向了高潮。

sentences.english: the climax of his naval career
sentences.chinese: 他海军生涯的巅峰

detailed_translations.english: the most exciting or important part of a story or experience, which usually comes near the end

name: recall
trans: 回忆， 回想 <；撤销， 收回

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

name: flap
trans: 垂下物； 帽檐； 袋盖；慌乱， 紧张

sentences.english: The flags were flapping in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 旗帜在微风中飘扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 飘动， 拍动； 振翅
detailed_translations.english: if a bird flaps its wings, it moves them up and down in order to fly

detailed_translations.chinese: 片状垂悬物；飘动，摆动，振动；激动，慌忙状态
detailed_translations.english: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily
to move quickly up and down or from side to side, often making a noise

sentences.english: She leapt over the fence.
sentences.chinese: 她跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
sentences.chinese: 他把一根枝条扔到河里，那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

detailed_translations.english: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
a big jump

sentences.english: Her objection was that he was too young.
sentences.chinese: 她反对的理由是他太小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 异议； 反对的理由
detailed_translations.english: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

sentences.english: a silk blouse
sentences.chinese: 丝质女衬衫

detailed_translations.english: a shirt for women

name: observation
trans: 观察； 观测； 监视；观察资料或报告； 言论

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: tremble
trans: 发抖， 颤抖；摇动， 晃动

sentences.english: His lip started to tremble and then he started to cry.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴唇开始颤抖，接着就哭了起来。

sentences.english: I will never forget the look on the patient's face, the tremble in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 我将永远不会忘记那病人脸上的表情和他颤抖的手。

detailed_translations.english: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
Tremble is also a noun

sentences.english: a city of six million inhabitants
sentences.chinese: 有600万居民的城市

detailed_translations.english: one of the people who live in a particular place

name: fraction
trans: 碎片； 小部分， 一点儿；分数

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

name: token
trans: 表示， 象征； 标志， 记号；礼券， 代金券；信物； 纪念品；筹码

sentences.english: slot-machine tokens
sentences.chinese: 自动贩卖机使用的代用币

sentences.english: Please accept this gift as a small token of our appreciation.
sentences.chinese: 区区薄礼，略表谢意，还请笑纳。

detailed_translations.english: a round piece of metal that you use instead of money in some machines

name: filter
trans: 滤器； 滤纸； 滤嘴

sentences.english: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
sentences.chinese: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。

sentences.english: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

sentences.english: coffee filter papers
sentences.chinese: 咖啡滤纸

sentences.english: filter cigarettes (= with a filter at the end )
sentences.chinese: 过滤嘴香烟

detailed_translations.english: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

sentences.english: ...an alien spaceship.
sentences.chinese: …一艘外星人的宇宙飞船。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle for carrying people through space

name: cease
trans: 停止； 终止； 结束

sentences.english: The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (= I am always surprised by them ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们的慈善义举总是让我感到惊讶。

sentences.english: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴。

sentences.english: without cease
sentences.chinese: 不停地，持续地

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing something or stop happening
(it is a noun only in the phrase `without cease') end

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

sentences.english: a priest’s robes
sentences.chinese: 牧师的长袍

detailed_translations.english: a long loose piece of clothing, especially one worn for official ceremonies

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

name: behaviour
trans: 行为， 举止；特性； 运转情况 A

sentences.english: It is important to reward good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 表现好要给予奖励，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the things that a person or animal does

name: scarce
trans: 缺乏的， 不足的；稀少的， 罕见的

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

sentences.english: You’ll have to join the queue.
sentences.chinese: 你得排队。

sentences.english: Some of the people queuing for tickets had been there since dawn.
sentences.chinese: 购票队伍中有些人天刚亮就来了。

detailed_translations.english: a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy something etc, or a line of vehicles waiting to move
to form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do something or go somewhere

name: argument
trans: 争论， 辩论；论据， 论点

sentences.english: She had a big argument with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫大吵了一架。

sentences.english: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.
sentences.chinese: 我们得提出有说服力的论据，证明为何要改变体制。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

sentences.english: That’s utter nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 真是一派胡言！

sentences.english: This company treats its employees with utter contempt.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司对其员工不屑一顾。

sentences.english: I watched in complete and utter horror as he pulled out a gun.
sentences.chinese: 我惊恐万分地看着他拔出枪来。

sentences.english: fifteen years of utter confusion
sentences.chinese: 15年的大混乱

detailed_translations.english: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty

name: adequate
trans: 足够的， 充分的； 恰当的

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.english: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

detailed_translations.chinese: 足够的； 可以胜任的
detailed_translations.english: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

name: hopeful
trans: 有希望的， 给以人希望的；抱有希望的； 充满希望的

sentences.english: Things might get better, but it doesn’t look very hopeful right now.
sentences.chinese: 情况也许会好转，但目前看来希望不大。

detailed_translations.english: making you believe that sth you want will happen; bringing hope

sentences.english: pork sausages
sentences.chinese: 猪肉香肠

detailed_translations.english: a small tube of skin filled with a mixture of meat, spices etc, eaten hot or cold after it has been cooked

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: escalate
trans: 逐步增长或发展， 更紧张；逐步上升， 逐步加强， 扩大

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: condense
trans: 压缩， 凝结；精简， 压缩

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: divert
trans: 使转向， 使改道；转移， 转移…的注意力 <；使娱乐， 使消遣

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

sentences.english: the importance of personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 个人卫生的重要性

sentences.english: a food hygiene training course
sentences.chinese: 食品卫生培训课程

detailed_translations.english: the practice of keeping yourself and the things around you clean in order to prevent diseases

name: justice
trans: 正义； 公平；审判， 司法， 法律制裁

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

sentences.english: The notice must be displayed in a conspicuous place.
sentences.chinese: 通告一定要贴在显眼的地方。

sentences.english: a bird with conspicuous white markings
sentences.chinese: 一种长有醒目白斑的鸟

sentences.english: I felt very conspicuous in my red coat.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着红外套，感觉自己十分显眼。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

sentences.english: You just search for an artist, song, album , or just a random search tag.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要搜索艺术家、歌曲、相册、或者仅仅是一个随机搜索标签。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of paper, plastic etc attached to something to show what it is, who owns it, what it costs etc
to attach a tag to something

name: verse
trans: 韵文， 诗；诗节， 诗句

sentences.english: Let’s sing the last verse again.
sentences.chinese: 我们把最后一节再唱一遍吧。

sentences.english: Learn the first two verses of the poem by heart.
sentences.chinese: 把这首诗的头两节背下来。

sentences.english: Genesis chapter 3, verse 13
sentences.chinese: 《创世记》第3章第13节

detailed_translations.english: a set of lines that forms one part of a song, poem, or a book such as the Bible or the Koran

name: furious
trans: 狂怒的； 狂暴的， 猛烈的

sentences.english: She was absolutely furious .
sentences.chinese: 她怒不可遏。

sentences.english: There was a furious row over the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 关于这些提议的争论非常激烈。

detailed_translations.english: very angry

sentences.english: So, what of the future of obesity in America?
sentences.chinese: 那么，未来美国的肥胖状况会怎么发展呢？

sentences.english: Dr.Watson is great on exercise as a cure for obesity.
sentences.chinese: 沃森医生把运动看做是治疗肥胖症的良方。

sentences.english: What is obesity?
sentences.chinese: 什么是肥胖？

detailed_translations.english: when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy

sentences.english: I wish I could get a tan like that.
sentences.chinese: 但愿我也能晒成那样的棕褐色肤色。

detailed_translations.chinese: （日晒后皮肤的）黝黑色；棕褐色；鞣料；马戏团
detailed_translations.english: the attractive brown colour that someone with pale skin gets after they have been in the sun
if you tan, or if the sun tans you, your skin becomes darker because you spend time in the sun
having a light yellowish-brown colour

sentences.english: high tar cigarettes
sentences.chinese: 高焦香烟

detailed_translations.english: a black substance, thick and sticky when hot but hard when cold, used especially for making road surfaces
to coat with tar

name: individual
trans: 个人的； 单独的； 独特的 <

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

sentences.english: No one told me about any briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 没有人和我提过什么公文包。

sentences.english: If you ask about my impression on him, I feel he looks like a typical businessman, you know, dark suit and briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 如果你问我对他的印象如何，我感觉他看起来像是个典型的商人，你知道，黑西装和公文包的那种。

sentences.english: Dennis peered into the room and saw her take a small red object out of her briefcase and quickly hide it in the bottom drawer of her dresser.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯窥视着房间里的一举一动，只见她从公文包里拿出一个红色的小东西，快速地把它藏在梳妆台最底下的抽屉里。

detailed_translations.english: a flat case used especially by business people for carrying papers or documents

sentences.english: The snowstorm added to our difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雪增加了我们的困难。

sentences.english: From beneath, it was at times like gazing into a snowstorm. It was hard not to think of souls.
sentences.chinese: 从下面往上看时，就像在暴风雪中抬头看到的一样，让人不禁想起了逝去的那些亡灵。

sentences.english: I step outside the house and nothing can stop me—the late season snowstorm, the puddle of standing water at the bottom of my porch steps that will never evaporate, the mud and muck this season brings.
sentences.chinese: 我踏出家门，没有任何事情能阻挡我——深冬季节的暴风雪、我家门廊台阶上那永远挥散不去的雨水坑，还有这个季节带来的烂泥和污秽。

detailed_translations.english: a storm with strong winds and a lot of snow

name: tax
trans: 对…征税；使负重担； 使受压力

sentences.english: No-one enjoys paying tax.
sentences.chinese: 没人喜欢缴税。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you must pay to the government according to your income, property, goods etc and that is used to pay for public services

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…征税； 使负担重， 使费尽力气
detailed_translations.english: to charge a tax on something

name: constrain
trans: 束缚， 限制；强迫， 强制

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: excitement
trans: 刺激； 激动， 兴奋

sentences.english: We were both new to the excitements of life in the big city.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩都是初次感受大城市多姿多彩的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激， 激动， 兴奋； 令人兴奋的事， 刺激的因素
detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being excited

sentences.english: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

detailed_translations.english: a plan for achieving something

sentences.english: an interim report
sentences.chinese: 中期报告

sentences.english: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
sentences.chinese: 他收到暂时支付的一万英镑。

sentences.english: An interim government was established.
sentences.chinese: 一个临时政府成立了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found

detailed_translations.chinese: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two events

name: testimony
trans: 证据； 证词；表明， 说明

sentences.english: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
sentences.chinese: 巴克的证词对控方的指控起到了关键作用。

sentences.english: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 他在证词中否认公司忽视了安全程序。

detailed_translations.english: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a  witness  makes in a court of law

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

sentences.english: The river glittered in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 阳光下河面波光粼粼。

detailed_translations.english: to shine brightly with flashing points of light

detailed_translations.chinese: 闪光， 灿烂的光辉； 耀眼， 辉煌
detailed_translations.english: brightness consisting of many flashing points of light

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: fragile
trans: 易碎的， 易损的；脆弱的， 易受伤害的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: reflexion
trans: 映像， 倒影；反省， 沉思

sentences.english: Can you see your reflexion in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: His speech was an accurate reflexion of the public mood.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 他的讲话是公众情绪的准确反映

sentences.english: ...the reflexion of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:  …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: cab
trans: 出租汽车； 轻便马车；司机室， 驾驶室 A

sentences.english: New York’s yellow cabs
sentences.chinese: 纽约的黄色出租车

sentences.english: Ralph tried to hail a cab (= wave to get a cab to stop for you ) .
sentences.chinese: 拉尔夫招手想叫一辆出租车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 驾驶室；出租汽车；出租马车
detailed_translations.english: a taxi

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: Basic courses in sociology and psychology as well as other humanities courses give students plenty of opportunity to explore their own emotions.
sentences.chinese: 社会学和心理学的基础，以及其他人文学科的课程，赋予学生大量的机会去探索其个人情感。

sentences.english: And I spent part of my second grade year in Sweden, where my father was on sabbatical as a professor of sociology.
sentences.chinese: 因为我父亲休假的缘故，我的小学二年级有一段时间是在瑞典上的，那个时候他是一名社会学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

sentences.english: a gigantic skyscraper
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼

detailed_translations.english: extremely big

sentences.english: His attackers turned and fled.
sentences.chinese: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
sentences.chinese: 正有蹲了六个月监狱，然后逃出了该国。

detailed_translations.english: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

name: distinct
trans: 清楚的， 明显的；截然不同的

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

sentences.english: He was visiting professor of geology at the University of Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是佐治亚大学的地质学客座教授。

sentences.english: the geology of the British Isles
sentences.chinese: 不列颠群岛的地质

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the earth, including the origin and history of the rocks and soil of which the earth is made

name: hedge
trans: 篱笆， 树篱； 障碍物

sentences.english: You’re hedging again - have you got the money or haven’t you?
sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

sentences.english: ‘That depends on my partner,’ she hedged.
sentences.chinese: “那取决于我的合伙人。”她避重就轻地答道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避免直接回答；   套头交易； 以套期保值避免损失
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question

detailed_translations.chinese: 保值措施；套期保值；树篱；防备；障碍物；套头，两面下注以避免损失
detailed_translations.english: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

name: weep
trans: 悲叹， 哀悼， 为…伤心

sentences.english: James broke down and wept.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯控制不住感情，哭了起来。

sentences.english: He wept bitterly (= cried a lot ) when it was time for us to leave.
sentences.chinese: 我们要分别的时候他痛哭了一场。

detailed_translations.english: to cry, especially because you feel very sad

name: tune
trans: 调音； 调频；调整； 调节

sentences.english: That’s a nice tune.
sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.english: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.english: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
sentences.chinese: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

detailed_translations.english: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
to make a musical instrument play at the right pitch

name: hoist
trans: 举起， 升起， 吊起

sentences.english: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
sentences.chinese: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

detailed_translations.english: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: numerical
trans: 数字的， 用数字表示的

sentences.english: a numerical code
sentences.chinese: 数字密码

sentences.english: The home team tried to utilize their numerical advantage (= the fact that they had more players than the other team ).
sentences.chinese: 主队试图利用他们在人数上的优势。

sentences.english: Make sure the files are organized in numerical order.
sentences.chinese: 务必把这些档案按数字顺序排列。

detailed_translations.english: expressed or considered in numbers

name: drama
trans: 戏剧； 剧本；戏剧性事件或场面

sentences.english: the great traditions of ancient Greek drama
sentences.chinese: 古希腊戏剧的伟大传统

sentences.english: a new drama series for Saturday nights
sentences.chinese: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧

sentences.english: a drama critic
sentences.chinese: 戏剧评论员

sentences.english: a courtroom drama
sentences.chinese: 法庭剧

sentences.english: a lavish costume drama
sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

sentences.english: He plays a Russian spy in the comedy drama ‘Sleepers’.
sentences.chinese: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏剧， 剧本； 戏剧性事件
detailed_translations.english: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: eligible
trans: 有条件被选中的， 有资格当选的； 合格的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

sentences.english: a pot of soup simmering on the stove
sentences.chinese: 在炉灶上煨着的一锅汤

sentences.english: a wood-burning stove
sentences.chinese: 烧木柴的火炉

detailed_translations.english: a piece of kitchen equipment on which you cook food in pots and pans, and that contains an oven

name: alarm
trans: 使惊恐， 惊动， 惊吓 A；向…报警； 警告

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

sentences.english: What is needed in such cases is a calm appraisal of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 在此类情况下需要的是对形势的冷静估计。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对...作出的评价；评价，鉴定，评估
detailed_translations.english: a statement or opinion judging the worth, value, or condition of something

sentences.english: the constant battle against weeds
sentences.chinese: 对付杂草的长期斗争

sentences.english: I've been weeding the flower beds.
sentences.chinese: 我一直在除花坛里的杂草。

detailed_translations.english: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly
to remove unwanted plants from a garden or other place

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

sentences.english: The company’s debt has ballooned in the past year.
sentences.chinese: 在过去一年里，公司的债务激增。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become larger in amount
an object made of brightly coloured thin rubber, that is filled with air and used as a toy or decoration for parties

name: orientation
trans: 方向， 方位， 定位；熟悉， 适应； 〈主美〉 情况介绍

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

name: motion
trans: 运动， 动；提议， 动议

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: idle
trans: 空闲的， 闲置的；无用的， 无效的；懒散的

sentences.english: I cannot afford to leave the land lying idle.
sentences.chinese: 我不能让土地闲置。

sentences.english: The whole team stood idle, waiting for the mechanic.
sentences.chinese: 整队人干站着等技工来。

sentences.english: The workers have been idle for the last six months.
sentences.chinese: 最近六个月工人们都很闲。

detailed_translations.english: not working or producing anything

sentences.english: My knowledge of the business is limited.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一行了解有限。

sentences.english: The organization has very limited resources.
sentences.chinese: 这家机构资源非常有限。

sentences.english: So far, the education reforms have had only limited success.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，教育改革只取得了有限的成效。

detailed_translations.english: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

sentences.english: the country’s economic plight
sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.english: he plighted his word to attempt it

detailed_translations.english: a very bad situation that someone is in
to give or pledge (one's word)

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

sentences.english: a shy and fearful child
sentences.chinese: 一个羞涩、胆怯的小孩

detailed_translations.english: frightened that something bad might happen

name: accent
trans: 腔调； 口音 A；重音

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

sentences.english: Now and then they heard the roar of a heavy lorry.
sentences.chinese: 他们不时听见一辆重型卡车的轰响声。

detailed_translations.chinese: （英）卡车；[车辆] 货车；运料车
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle for carrying heavy goods

name: fragment
trans: 碎片； 小部分， 片断 <

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: carrier
trans: 运送者， 载体； 携带者

sentences.english: a baby carrier
sentences.chinese: 婴儿背带

detailed_translations.english: something used for carrying something

name: response
trans: 回答， 回音；反应， 响应

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

sentences.english: people in the over-45 age category
sentences.chinese: 属45岁以上年龄组的人

sentences.english: Seats are available in eight of the ten price categories .
sentences.chinese: 座位共有10种票价，现有8种可售。

sentences.english: Williams’ style does not fit easily into the category of jazz.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯的风格不能轻易归入爵士乐的范畴。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are all of the same type

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc
